loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 59 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to Charles who is a businessman and, together, they are blessed with two children who are now adults, 25 and 23 years old.

Cecilia owns a general store where she sells cereals, like beans, maize, greengrams, wheat, and other items, like cooking fat, sugar, flour, and rice. To be able to add more stocks of these items, Cecilia has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which is her third one.

From her general store, she makes a monthly income of KES 30,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start another business, by buying a dairy cow.

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to be financially stable and to be able to buy a pickup truck for transporting her cereals to other markets.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals, cooking fat, sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a hard-working man who lives in a rural area with his family. He is a father and a good husband to his smart wife. He is the main breadwinner to his family. He has been busy with farming for more than five years now. He grows rice and corn. 

Joselito wants to develop his farming and to maximize his profit. For this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она единственная кормилица в семье. Гулнисо одинокая женщина. Ее муж бросил ее и женился на другой женщине. После развода ей была очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Она была ранена душевно. Гулнисо благодаря своему знанию и тем ресурсам, которых выложили ей ее родители, смогла преодолеть трудность и поставить себя на ноги. Сегодня она работает в государственном учреждении и ежемесячно получает зарплату. Она постепенно улучшает условию проживания. Гулнисо хочет купить мебель для своего дома, но не имеет денег. Она использует свою зарплату для покупки продуктов питания и одежды. Гулнисо запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulniso is a woman with a beautiful spirit and beautiful thoughts. She is the only breadwinner in her family. Gulniso is a lonely woman, as her husband left her and married another woman. After the divorce she had a very difficult time managing the family's expenses as she was heartbroken. Thanks to her skills and the resources her parents left her, Gulniso was able to overcome difficulty and get back on her feet. Today she works in a government establishment, earns a monthly salary and is gradually improving her quality of life. Gulniso wants to buy furniture for her house but does not have the money as she uses her salary to buy groceries and clothing. She is requesting a loan for $1,300 USD to purchase furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, juice, milk, bath soap, shampoo, etc., in her general store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, juice, milk, bath soap, shampoo, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is 25 years old and married, with two children.

Gretchen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, and groceries.

Gretchen has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gretchen aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas la socia tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz y azúcar para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de útiles escolares, negocio de venta de útiles escolares, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “PROSPEREMOS-CUSCO" (May we Prosper) communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district, province and department of Cuzco. 

Felicitas, a member, is married and has 3 children. She continues working in her grocery store. The member has been doing this job for a long time which has brought her both economical and personal satisfaction. Felicitas is a responsible and hard working person. She sells different types of products such as fizzy drinks, rice, sugar among other products. She hopes to continue working to continue supporting her family.

Felicitas is requesting a loan to purchase rice and sugar for her business.

The other members work in the following businesses; restaurant, grocery store, school supplies, clothing, and shoes.

The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

Felicitas is grateful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to complete the payments on the loan according to the established terms

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Orifdzhon

texts.ru: Орифчон жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он не смог создать свою семью, так как с самого детства имеет неизлечимую болезнь. Но этот удар судьбы не сломал его, и по сей день он продолжает жить и радоваться за других людей. Орифчон очень трудолюбивый человек. Он живёт со своими родителями, и чтобы полностью не быть на их обеспечении, он сам ведёт свой бизнес. Он продаёт диски на местном рынке. Для этого у него есть небольшой ларёк. От этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход и может помогать своим родителям иметь достаточно финансов на проживание.  Но, чтобы обеспечить своё будущее, ему  нужно расширять свой бизнес. Чтобы осуществить свои мечты о расширении своего бизнеса, ему не хватило собственного капитала и он обратился за кредитом в Арванд. Орифчон хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить различные диски в большом количестве для дальнейшей продажи. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Orifdzhon is a cheerful and positive man of 35. He was unable to have his own family, since he has had an incurable illness since childhood. But this stroke of fate has not broken him, and to this day he continues to live and be happy for other people. Orifdzhon is a very hardworking man who lives with his parents and, in order to not be fully dependent on them, runs his own business. He sells CDs at the local market, for which he has a small stall. He receives good earnings from this business and is able to help his parents cover living costs. But as insurance for the future, he needs to expand his business. He didn't have enough of his own capital to attain his dreams of business expansion, and has turned to Arvand for a loan. Orifdzhon would like a loan to purchase various high-quality CDs for further resale. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy CDs for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 53 years old and married to Lucy, with three children who are in school.

He is in a business of selling clothes in Naivasha, which he has operated for three years.

Patrick has applied for his first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), to enable him to purchase stocks of clothes to sell. With the anticipated profit, Patrick plans to pay school fees and to buy more stock for his business.

In the near future, he hopes to open a another clothing shop in Naivasha.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, ha decidido solicitar otro crédito para mejorar su vivienda (instalar cerámica), comprara cerámica, cemento, arena, etc., con la inversión que hizo con anterioridad fortaleció su negocio, genero más ingresos que le ayudaron a ir cancelando las cuotas de su préstamo.
Ella puede apoyar más a su familia, ha mejorado su vivienda y le da lo necesario a su hija para que siga estudiando sin alguna limitante. Su negocio sigue muy activo.
texts.en:
Zoila has decided to request another loan to improve her home (install tiles), she will but tiles, cement, sand etc., with the investment that she made previously she has strengthened her business, improved her income and this has helped her to pay off her previous loan.

She can support her family, has improved her home and does what she can so her daughter can continue studying without any limits. Her business continues to do well.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, sand,  etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines, which she has had for two years.

Christine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Christine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, which she has had for 20 years.

Josie requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Gina

texts.en:
Ana Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. Ana Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock like soft drinks, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Ana Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like soft drinks, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling native baskets in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.

Fe is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business like rattan, bamboo, and other items. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like rattan, bamboo, and other items

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромжон родился в сельской местности. Он трудолюбивый, добродушный человек. Очень любит природу. Все его детство прошло в полевых местах. Ему 26 лет. Женат. Имеет двух прекрасных детей. Жена Икромжона домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей. Сам Икромжон занимается куплей продажей риса. С села оптом привозит рис и раздает по районам. Он еще параллельно работает таксистом. У него есть свой личный автомобиль. Икромжон из-за всех сил старается чтоб его семья жила в достатке. Ведь он единственный добытчик семьи. Для этого Икромчон решил начать еще одно дело, откорм и купля продажа мелко рогатого скота. У него уже имеется несколько голов скота, но он хотел бы увеличить их поэтому обратился в " Арванд" за кредитом. Цель Икромжона: Благополучие и улучшение жизни его семьи.
texts.en: Ikromjon was born in a rural area. He is a hardworking, kindhearted man of 26 who loves nature and spent his whole childhood in agricultural areas. Ikromjon is married and has two beautiful children. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the children, while his occupation is buying and selling rice. He takes rice from the village and distributes it around the region. At the same time, he works as a taxi driver, using his own private vehicle. Ikromjon tries with all his might to ensure his family has enough, since he is the only earner in the family. Because of this he has decided to begin yet another business, buying, fattening and selling small-horned cattle. He already has a few heads of cattle, but he would like to increase the number and has therefore turned to Arvand for a loan. Ikromjon's goal is the well-being and improved life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase of  livestock

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 49, and dreaming to live a comfortable life with her family. This pushes her to work harder for the attainment of this goal. 

She sells a variety of fish for an income in order to meet the growing needs of her family. Her weekly gross income was used in the maintenance of her business. and some of their basic needs.  

However, this was not enough and therefore she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy a quantity of different kinds of fish. She believes that this loan will greatly help her towards business success.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of different kinds of fish

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and married. She has eight children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Leala Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leala Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell rice business and raising pigs. Leala Grace is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Leala Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 52 years old and married with three children. For the past three years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from operating a general store. 

Angelita is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her business. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with six children. For the past 10 years, she has earned a living raising pigs in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from vending food.

Erlinda is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 45-year-old man. He lives with his mother in a small village in the Tskaltubo district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. George works as a musician and gets a small monthly income which is not enough for the family. 

George decided to start his own agricultural business, and requested a loan. The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 4,000 GEL for purchasing building materials to build a greenhouse. 

As the greenhouse is built, he will sow cucumbers and tomatoes and sell the harvested products. This will increase the income of their family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 61 años, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, es casada y tiene un hijo que ya es independiente, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su esposo. El trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de pescado. Tiene su puesto en el puerto de pescadores de la ciudad. Se levanta muy temprano para comprar al por mayor sus productos a los pescadores que llegan con todo lo recolectado en su jornada de pesca. Selecciona aquellas especies que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes, además se abastece de aquellos que no son tan solicitados pero que tienen muy buen precio en el mercado. Compra por canastas al por mayor y los vende por kilos, lleva realizando este trabajo por 41 años aproximadamente y menciona que con esta actividad pudo proveer de alimentación y educación a su hijo, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es el único medio de generar ingresos para su hogar. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de S/.500 soles, comprará pescados de gran demanda entre sus clientes en mayor cantidad ya que en esta temporada el consumo de ciertas especies se incrementa.
texts.en:
Olga, 61, is a responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has a son who is already independent, she has her own home where she lives with her husband. 

Olga sells fish for a living. She has her post in the fishing port of her city. She gets up very early to buy her products from the fishermen who arrive with everything that they have collected in their day of fishing.

She selects the species that receive the greatest demand for from her customers as well as some others that are less in demand, but which receive a good price at market. She buys products by the basket and sells them by the kilo. She has been doing this job for around 41 years and mentions that this activity allowed her to provide food and education for her son and that she continues in the trade as it is her only way of earning an income for her household.

This is her sixth Kiva loan, she is very grateful for the opportunity she is offered and for the financial support that she needs to continue her work. With the requested sum of 500 PEN she will buy the most in demand fish in vast quantities as it is now the season that the consumption of certain species increases.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fish.

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 20 years, Ave has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack food, soft-drinks, and other groceries.

Ave is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old and married.  

Erlinda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds, and other supplies for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Beautizima

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Beautizima works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Beautizima is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Beautizima has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a cattle-raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Florenda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and married with four children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Nilda has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns additional income from a piggery.

Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard works hard to support his family. Richard is single and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Richard requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for his livestock. Richard has been in this business for 8 years now.

Richard would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for his livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 43 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past two years, Lolita has been running a general store in the Philippines. 

Lolita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as spices, canned goods, egg, noodles, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as spices, canned goods, egg, and noodles

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a direct selling business. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean her farm and pay the coffee cutters.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter grew up in Thika, which is north of Nairobi, Kenya; he currently lives in the Mukuru informal settlement in the heart of the capitol city. He is a business-oriented youth who likes to have a clean environment around him. 

Mukuru is a slum that poses various challenges to the youth, the largest challenge being unemployment. To overcome the challenge of unemployment, Peter would like to purchase and run sanitation facilities in the slums. He therefore seeks funding to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets for his community to use. The waste is recycled and sold to farmers for fertilizer.

Peter is confident that this business venture will earn him enough to create more opportunities for the other youth and give him a sense of fulfillment when his environment is clean.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Ma. Nilfa

texts.en:
Ma. Nilfa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Ma. Nilfa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, candies, snack foods, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

In the future, Ma. Nilfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, candies, snack foods, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café para que la cosecha pueda tener un buen desarrollo y un maduración adecuada, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y a la vez  ir renovando la plantación, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mario, 57, is married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. 

With this loan he intends to buy fertilizer and fungicide and to pay for manual labour; to assist in the coffee production in order to have a good harvest and an appropriate ripeness. In addition, he wants to buy some coffee plants to replant. 

The goal is to increase the density of plants and at the same time to renew the plantation, as well as taking advantage of the good fertile ground, the climate conditions and other aspects that help in the coffee crops. With these improvements to the crops, he hopes to obtain some profits and thus improve his family's living conditions as well as invest a little more in the crops and to fulfill some goals. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans with state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide and to pay for manual labour to assist in the coffee production.

loans.name: Marialen

texts.en:
Marialen is 28 years old and married with two children who are in school; Marialen works very hard to provide for them.

Marialen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like diapers, eggs, chips, shampoo, etc to sell.

Marialen has been in this business for five years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like diapers, eggs, chips, shampoo, etc to sell

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 27 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Jonah has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for fishing.

Jonah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for fishing.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 52 years old and widowed with six children, one of whom is in school. Marlene works very hard to provide for them.

Marlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. Marlene has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Marlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 64-year-old man. He lives with his son in a small village in the Tskaltubo district. 

Davit is involved in a dairy business. He has two cows and three calves. He milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell at local markets.

Davit decided to start an additional business, and requested a loan. The start up program, which is a joint initiative betwen Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 500 GEL to purchase polyethylene to cover a greenhouse. 

As the greenhouse is built he will sow greens and tomatoes there and sell them. This will increase the income of his family, and with increased income he will expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene to cover a greenhouse

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman who has been blessed with three children; one is in school, and two are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kadzo has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase charcoal to sell.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson resides the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. He owns a single room house which he has rented out. Peter wishes to be financially stable in the future and become a successful businessman. He has decided that he'd like to begin with a Fresh Life toilet business. 

Peterson says that only through investing in the sanitation sector will he be able to make a visible impact on his community. He seeks funding to enable him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to be set up in his area of residence. Peterson hopes that his business will be successful and expand. In the future, he hopes to purchase more rental property to facilitate his dream of attaining financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a young, industrious gentleman who is 24 years old. For the last year, he has been employed in the motorcycle transport industry and he earns about 20,000 KES each month. Antony supports his parents and two of his siblings who are in school. He learned about KADET from his fellow riders who have already received KADET funding. 

Antony is requesting a 91,019 KES loan to acquire his own motorcycle. This will be his first loan. He is likely to increase his income and expand his established clientele list. Antony will use the profit from his loan to repay his debt as well as provide for his family’s needs. In the future, he hopes to acquire more assets and be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 49 years old and widowed with eight children. For the past ten years, she has been farming vegetables and she also earns additional income from selling food and cultivating coconuts. 

Perlita is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 48 years old and married to Esther, who is a farmer. His is from Nyahururu and he and his wife have four children ages 26, 24, 13 and 10. For the last seven years, Stephen has been a shopkeeper who sells items such as sugar, flour, rice, and cooking fat. His monthly income right now is 25,000 KES.

Stephen is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan from KADET LTD to buy more items such as maize flour, tissue paper, sugar, rice, biscuits, and cooking fat to sell to his customers. This will be his third loan. Stephen plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and to add more stock to his shop. His hopes and dreams for the future of his business and family are to be stable.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, tissue paper, sugar, rice, biscuits, and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Shown in the photo above, Moath is 27 years old and single. He lives with his parents in a simple house in Tulkarm, Palestine.

For the past year Moath has owned a small internet cafe. It is a good business, as it helps high school and university students and is a source of entertainment for younger kids.

Moath is aiming to improve and expand his business. He is applying for a 800 USD loan from FATEN to buy another computer for his internet cafe. This will help his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy another computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome is 44 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for them. For the past 15 years, Ma. Salome has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Ma. Salome is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks such as canned goods, feed, rice, laundry soap, diapers, and other groceries to sell in her general store. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, feeds, rice, laundry soap, diapers, and other groceries

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne comes from a family of three and resides in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. She grew up in Kawangware and loves taking part in community improvement activities. Anne recently realized that she could be able to comfortably achieve helping her community by improving sanitation in her area. 

Anne seeks a loan to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. She aims to use these to create a more habitable environment and earn income from the business for her upkeep. She will be satisfied to know that she made an impact on the well-being of her community. Anne hopes to make a greater impact in the future by expanding her toilet business.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a mother of two living in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. She is a landlady as well as a small-scale business woman. In the past, Leah got business experience by selling groceries, but currently she sells firewood. Leah believes that good service is the key to retaining customers, which leads to business expansion, but she feels that her firewood business has not given her a chance to provide this kind of service. 

Leah therefore seeks funding to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets, which she believes will enable her to provide the kind of service that she desires for her customers. She also says that the Fresh Life toilets will go a long way in reducing sanitation-related diseases and allow her community members to have a better quality lifestyle than they currently do.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 36, is married to Kellen. They are blessed with two children. Joseph has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past two years. He earns 10,000 KES a month, which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for a 30,000 KES loan with KADET. He repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy a water pump to help irrigate his farm so they can start growing and selling vegetables. With the anticipated profits from the farm he will repay his loan with KADET and pay school fees for his children.

Joseph hopes to buy a vehicle to help transport his vegetables. He also dreams of building a comfortable home for his family.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to help irrigate his farm

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Raylen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal, fish and dried fish. Raylen is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Raylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in expanding the space where she has a cyber cafe and to set it up to be able to give computer classes.

loans.name: Norva

texts.en:
Norva is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Norva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a hardworking married woman. She is a mother of four children; one is grown, two are in school and one is still too young to attend. The family’s house has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past three years Umazi has sold charcoal. Her clients are neighbors and passersby.

Umazi decided to join Yehu to access funds that would help her improve her business. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy twenty sacks of charcoal to sell. She dreams of selling it wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, necesita invertir en compra de aceite, maíz, harina, etc., para elaborar diferentes antojitos,  reconoce que el buen uso de los créditos le genero cambios positivos como mayores ingresos, clientes satisfechos y la ampliación de su negocio.
Debido a las mejorías que ha tenido en su economía, ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, tienen mejor alimentación y mejor salud.
texts.en: Modesta needs to buy oil, corn, flour, and more to make different appetizers. She realizes that good use of funding creates positive changes like better income, satisfied customers, and business growth. The improvement in her finances has made her family's living conditions better, and they have better nutrition and health.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clear out her farm and contract coffee plant cutters.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana continua dedicándose a  la administración de su restaurante pollería, actividad que viene realizando para desde hace algunos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.

Ana está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como pollos, verduras y papas para la producción de su pollería. Ana está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Ana continues to make her living running her poultry restaurant, as she has done for the last few years.  It has allowed her to get her three children ahead. 

Ana is requesting the loan to purchase supplies such as chickens, vegetables and potatoes for use in her poultry restaurant.  Ana is very grateful for the lenders' help.  They have helped her to strengthen her business, which will allow her to offer her children a better education.  Ana belongs to the communal bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple) in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as chickens, vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La socia es la señorita María que continua dedicandose al  comercio de elementos de artesanías en general como ropa, joyería y adornos. María está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pulseras, anillos, aretes, adornos y ropa como chompas, bufandas y gorros, para capitalizar su actividad. María está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: The member is María, who continues to sell artesania such as clothing, jewelry, and accessories. María has applied for a loan to buy merchandise like bracelets, rings, earrings, accessories, and clothing such as sweaters, scarves, and caps for her business. María thanks the lenders for helping her strengthen her business, through which she provides a better education for her children. She belongs to the communal bank “El Templo del Inca” in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, clothing, and accessories.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pasamanería, negocio de relojes, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Jesus es el Camino y la verdad,” which is located in the Anta district in Anta province in Cusco department. Maria, 43, is a member and is married and has four children. She raises and fattens animals--guinea pigs and chickens--to later sell at various fairs. This small business has allowed her to provide for her children. 

She dreams of having a shop where she could sell the guinea pigs and chickens. She has applied for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals. The other members sell trimmings, watches, groceries, and food. The member thanks those who share this dream, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Siuta

texts.en:
Siuta is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. 

To earn a living, she operates a cattle farm. She has been doing this for three years. Siuta is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire, nails, posts, crowbars, and knives. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Siuta hopes to use her profit to support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, nails, posts, crowbars, and knives

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de zapatos,ella vende los zapatos por medio de catalogos y ofrece a sus amigos,la socia trabaja en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos.La socia solicita le credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en: Nieves continues selling shoes to her friends via catalog.  She works independently from 8am until 5pm.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her shoes.  She’s asking for the loan to buy shoes.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jhon Henrry

texts.es:
Jhon continua dedicandose al rubro de la construcción civil y es con esta actividad sacrificada que saca adelante a su familia.  Jhon está solicitando el préstamo para comprar herramientas martillos , taladros y materiales de trabajo como cemento y mayolicas, que le faciliten el proceso de su trabajo.

Jhon está muy agradecido con los inversionitas por ayudarlo en su actividad y permitirle llevar el sustento a su familia. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Jhon continues to make his living in the area of civil construction.  With this demanding work, he has been able to get his family ahead.  Jhon is requesting the loan in order to purchase tools, hammers, drills and construction materials like cement and tile, which will make his work easier. 

Jhon is grateful to the lenders for helping him with his business and allowing him to support his family.  He belongs to the communal bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple) in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase tools, hammers, drills and construction materials such as cement and tile.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is studying B.S. in Business Administration at Southern Colleges, Oroquieta City. Her father is a fisherman, while her mother is a fish vendor. Her parents are helping each other in order to augment their living. She has two sibling that need support too.

Her determination of helping her family in the future makes her aggressive to pursue her studies. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fee for her first semester this current year. Her dream is to have a better living with her family in future.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fee for her first semester.

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
Ada, ha decidido tomar otro préstamo para invertir por mayoreo en su tienda, comprara: gaseosas, jugos, golosinas (dulces, galletas, etc.), maíz, frijoles y otros. Pues con el capital que anterior pudo fortalecer su negocio, sus ganancias han subido y hoy la demanda es mucho mayor.
Ada tiene mejores ingresos lo que le permiten salir con los compromisos que tiene con su familia, y está ahorrando para poder comprar un terreno.
texts.en: Ada has decided to take out another loan to stock her store by wholesale.  She will buy soft-drinks, juice, snacks (cookies, candy, etc.), corn, beans and others.  She was able to strengthen the business with her previous capital and her profits and demand have both risen to date.  Ada’s income is higher so she’s able to better fill family needs; she’s saving up to be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда очень трудолюбивый человек. Она одновременно занимается несколькими видами деятельности. Она родилась в 1988 году в маленьком селе своего  района. Замужем. Имеет высшее образование. Махсуда работает преподавателем в средней школе своего  села. Кроме этого она имеет собственный бизнес и занимается откормом скота, чтобы улучшить условия своей жизни. Махсуда собирается увеличить число своих скотов и для этого ей трудно накопить денег, так как доходы, которые она получает расходует для кормления семьи и поддержания жизненного условия в семье. По этому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Она выражает благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество с организацией.
texts.en:
Makhsuda is a very hardworking woman. She works with several types of activities at the same time. She was born in 1988 in a small village in her region. She is married and has higher education. 

Makhsuda works as a teacher at the high school in her village. In addition, she also has her own business of fattening cattle, in order to increase her living conditions. Makhsuda decided to increase the number of cattle she has, and it is hard for her to save up money for this, as the income which she receives she spends on feeding and supporting the living conditions of her family. Therefore she turned to Arvand for a loan. 

Makhsuda expresses gratefulness for the financial support to Arvand and hopes for further cooperation with the organization.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maria Romana

texts.es: Doña María Romana se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primera solicitud de crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para su Piñero por lo que pudo aplicar y sacar una buena y sana cosecha para su venta.  Ella tuvo una excelente producción de piña por lo que pudo vender como lo había previsto a muy buen precio y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió una parte en sus en sus cultivos y la otra fue destinada para nueva mente preparar la tierra, limpiar la plantación que tiene para la próxima cosecha y pagar mano de obra para cultivar un poco más. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados hasta tal punto que sobrepasaron sus expectativas. Por lo que esta vez ha decidido solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual puedan aumentar el volumen de sus cultivos ya que la demanda que tiene no la puede cubrir en su totalidad con lo que en estos momentos cultivo.  Ella espera se le sea apoyada nuevamente para seguir gozando de los beneficios que la Cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA brinda para apoyar a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
María Romana is very happy because she was able to use her first loan to buy supplies needed for her pineapple crop that she was able to apply and get a good, healthy harvest as a result.  She had excellent pineapple production that she was able to sell  for a very good price as planned and she was able to repay her loan.

Profits were very good and she reinvested part of them into her crops and the other part was used to prepare the soil once again, to clear weeds for the next planting and to pay labor costs to plant a bit more.  There was a change in her business because production improved thanks to the initial loan and so did her quality of life because she earned the expected income and even surpassed it.

This time she’s decided on a second loan to increase production because she’s unable to fully meet customer demand with the amount she’s currently growing.  She hopes to be helped again to continue enjoying the benefits that Comixmul cooperative in alliance with KIVA provides to support people of scarce resources.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 29 años, es madre soltera y enfrenta el mundo con valor y fuerza por el bienestar de su único hijo de 9 años, ella vive en casa de su madre junto a su hermana y su menor hijo. El trabajo de Edith consiste en la venta al por menor de productos comestibles, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando por 11 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su madre pero ahora el negocio es solo de ella y recibe la ayuda de su hermana en algunas ocasiones cuando ella tiene que cumplir otras funciones fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además es la única bodega en su zona. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros
texts.en: Edith is 29-years old.  She is a single mother and faces the world with bravery and strength for the sake of her only son, who is 9-years old.  She lives in her mother's home with her sister and her youngest son.  Edith's work consists of selling retail food items including rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables and other items.  She has the business set up in her house, is open every day and works full-time.  She has been working for eleven years in this line of work.  In the beginning, Edith's mother helped her, but now the business is Edith's alone.  Sometimes her sister helps her, when she has things to do outside of the house.  What Edith likes about her work is that she has time to do other, temporary activities.  Fortunately, business is going very well for her and she always has customers due to the variety of products she offers for sale.  In addition, hers is the only small grocery the neighborhood. This is Edith's sixth loan with Kiva.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity she has been offered and for the financial backing that she needs to keep moving forward.  With the requested sum of 3000 soles (USD $1100), Edith will purchase merchandise for re-sale in her small grocery including sweets, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, vegetables and other items.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción, de 35 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 09 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en la casa de su madre. El trabajo de Asunción consiste en la venta de ropa y sábanas. Ofrece al público diversas prendas y accesorios de cama en diversos diseños, colores y modelos. Sus clientes son basicamente sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, además de algunos nuevos clientes que siempre llegan por recomendación. Algunas veces le solicitan pedidos con anticipación, los cuales reparte en el transcurso del día . Lleva 03 años en este rubro y trabaja sola ya que su esposo tiene otra actividad económica. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer muchas cosas diferentes, además tiene independencia y dispone de su tiempo para dirigirse a zonas o lugares donde cree que realizar alguna venta y conseguir nuevos clientes. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ropa y sábanas al por mayor ya que así compra a mejores precios logrando tener mayores ganancias por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Asunción, 35, is happy and dynamic. She is married and has two children, ages 17 and 9, who live with her in her mother's house. Asunción sells clothing and sheets, different styles of garments, and bed accessories. Her customers are mostly friends, family, and neighbors, as well as new customers to whom she is recommended. Sometimes she take orders, which she fills in a day. She has run her business for three years and works alone, as her husband has another job. What she likes most about her work is doing a variety of things, being independent, and having time to go to places where she thinks she can make a sale or find new customers. 

This is her sixth loan cycle with Kiva, and she thanks all the people who make funding available so that she can be more successful in her work. She promises to continue to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of 2500 soles to buy wholesale clothing and sheets at better prices, which will produce more profit on her sales.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing and sheets.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school; Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as Yakult, eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoos, groceries, etc.

Zenaida has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as Yakult, eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoos, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sarvelio

texts.es:
Sarbelio, nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas (semilla, abonos, herbicidas, etc.), para tener todo listo para sembrar. Con la inversión anterior él tuvo una  cosecha más grande, sus ganancias aumentaron y tiene más clientes.
Su familia cuanta con el mismo número de integrantes, están todos saludables, tienen una alimentación mejor, su negocio es más amplio y sigue trabajando para para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sarbelio is once again asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies (seed, manure, herbicide, etc.) to have everything necessary to plant.  He obtained a larger crop yield with the previous loan and his profits and his clientele increased.  His family still has the same number of members and they are all healthy.  Their nutrition is better and his business is larger; he continue working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ligia Grace

texts.es: Ligia Grace tiene la edad de 57 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere  comprar dos novillos para hacerlos bueyes y que le sirvan para acarreo de productos de la finca, caña, café, leña, ect.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva, tiene trapiche para hacer dulce de tapa, también produce plantas ornamentales y orquídeas. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Ligia Grace, 57, is married with three children who are her greatest priority.  She wants to buy two calves to develop into oxen so that they can work hauling her farm products: sugarcane, coffee, firewood, etc.  She’s been working in agriculture for several years and she wants to grow and be more productive.  She has a sugar mill to make ‘dulce de tapa’ [type of brown sugar] and she also grows ornamental plants and orchids.

This is her first Fudecosur loan.   She’s had no previous loan with state banks or cooperatives and Fudecosur offered her the best terms and a much lower interest rate.  She would also like to provide her children with the necessary education so that they can be well-prepared adults in future so that they can face life more easily.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.ru: Мукарама является мастером своего дела.  Её 32 года. Она уже давно занимается услугой швеи, так как после окончания средней школы у нее не было возможности поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Она научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Мукарама опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Она уже имеет огромный опыт работы. Ее муж Абдучамил трудовой мигрант и она должна сама обеспечивать своих 2 детей Аличона и Ибодата.  Мукарама должна увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки и ткани, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки новой швейной машинки и ткани. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukarama is a master in her business. She is 32 years old. She has already had a sewing service for a long time, as she did not have an opportunity to start university and receive higher education after finishing high school. She learned to sew women's clothing from a dressmaker. 

Mukarama is an experienced dressmaker and creates masterpieces - Tajik national dresses. She already has great experience with the work. Her husband, Abduchamil, is a migrant worker and she needs to provide for her two children, Alichon and Ibodat, by herself. 

Mukarama should increase her working capital and in this way increase the income. She needs a new sewing machine and fabric, but her pay does not allow her to buy this. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar to purchase a new sewing machine and fabric. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine and fabrics for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, insecticide, weed killer, etc.).

loans.name: Orlina

texts.en:
Orlina is 36 years old and married with seven children.

Orlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

Orlina has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for 9 years, and earns an income from tricycle transport.

Orlina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell, for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Rosa has been in this business for 5 years. Rosa earns more income from pig fattening.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adin

texts.es:
José, esta es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, de él dependen todos los ingresos de su hogar. Desde que era un niño se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol. El ve en la utilización de créditos una herramienta para tener a tiempo lo necesario para la siembra, por esa razón él solicita la ayuda para comprar abono, semillas, herbicidas, etc.
El proyecto de vida de José es aumentar el área de cosecha e ingresos; de esa forma tener el capital necesario y poder construir un invernadero que le facilite la siembra de otra clase de productos agrícolas. Todo esto le ayudar a mejorar las condiciones en que vive  su familia y darles la oportunidad de educación superior a sus hijos para que ellos se desenvuelvan en un ambiente diferente.
texts.en:
José’s married living with his wife and three children; the entire family income comes from him.  He's been growing corn and beans since he was a boy.  He sees using loans as a tool to have everything needed for the crops in time and this is why he’s asking for help to buy manure, seed, herbicide, etc.

José’s life project is to increase his acreage in cultivation and his income in order to have the capital needed to build a nursery that will make planting other agricultural products easier.  All of this will help him to improve the conditions his family lives in and to give his children the opportunity of higher education so that they will develop in a different environment.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito que le ayudara a surtir más su negocio con productos que sus clientes están demandando, con el capital comprara golosinas (dulces, galletas, etc.), jugos, gaseosas y productos de la canasta básica. Los resultados de la inversión anterior fueron muy positivos por que hoy cuenta con un negocio más amplio, nuevos clientes y  más ganancias.
Su núcleo familiar sigue siendo el mismo, se encuentran con buena salud, su alimentación es mejor, ha podido ir cancelando la deuda adquirida. Está dispuesta a seguir trabajando para mantener su negocio activo y seguir velando por  el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María is opting for a new loan that will help her better stock her business with products her customers are requesting.  She will use the capital to buy snacks (candy, cookies, etc.), juice, soft-drinks and basic staple items.  Her previous investment yielded positive results for today her business is larger, she has more customers and profits are higher.

Her immediate family remains unchanged; they are in good health, their nutrition is better and she’s been able to repay the debt she took on.  She’s ready to continue working to keep her business active and to continue watching over her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, está preparando todo para la época de siembra por lo que está solicitando nuevamente capital para comprar abono, insecticidas y semillas (maíz y Frijol). Con la inversión anterior ella tuvo lo necesario para sembrar un área mayor y así tener más producción en la cosecha.
Su vivienda ha sido mejorada, ofrece mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, el apoyo a su hija en los estudios sigue siendo constante, todo esto lo ha logrado con el aumento de sus ingresos y la buena administración del negocio.
texts.en: Teresa is getting everything ready for planting season, so she has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and corn and bean seed. The previous loan provided what she needed to sow a large area and yield a bigger harvest. Her house has been renovated, and her family's living conditions are better. She continues to help her son with his education. She has accomplished all this with increased income and better administration of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and corn and bean seed.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 38 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 08 años, ella vive en casa de su cuñado a lado de su hijo, su esposo y la familia de su cuñado. Flor se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella desde temprano esta muy activa ya que sale a hacer sus compras al mercado y busca los mejores ingredientes para así poder brindar buenos alimentos a sus fieles clientes quienes la buscan siempre por su buena sazón y su trato amable. Tiene un puesto de ventas ubicado en el puerto de pescadores el cual es muy concurrido por la población lo que le permite vender rápidamente. Lleva haciendo este trabajo por 21 años y recibe la ayuda de su madre con quien comparte las responsabilidades del negocio. Complementa este trabajo alquilando una furgoneta que adquirió hace un año. Le gusta mucho cocinar, creció haciendo esto a lado de su madre y le agrada trabajar junto a ella, además le da tiempo por las tardes para poder realizar otras actividades, sus clientes son fieles y siempre la buscan porque prepara deliciosos y muy variados potajes, ya que no solo  cocina platillos regionales, sino también nacionales. Este es su quinto crédito con Kiva, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 soles, comprara materiales para seguir con su negocio, pues necesita nuevas ollas, mas cubiertos y además comprará ingredientes tales como carnes, verduras, arroz, entre otros.
texts.en:
Flor, 38, is married with an 8-year-old son.  She lives in her brother-in-law’s house with her son, husband and brother-in-law’s family.  Flor works selling food.  She’s active very early in the morning for she goes out to make her purchases at the market seeking the best ingredients to provide good meals for her loyal customers who always seek her out because of her tasty cooking and her kind treatment.

Her food stand is located in the fishing port which is very busy with lots of people which leads to quick sales.  She’s been in business 21 years and her mother helps her with the business responsibilities.  She complements this work with leasing out a delivery van she bought a year ago.

She enjoys cooking very much.  She grew up doing this alongside her mother and she enjoys working with her.  Besides, it gives her time to do other things in the afternoon.  Her customers are loyal and always seek her out because her dishes are delicious and varied for she not only cooks regional dishes but also national ones.

This is her 5th Kiva loan and she’s very happy for the financial support she’s getting for she’ll feel more secure about advancing with her work.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy supplies to continue working for she needs new pots, more cutlery and she will also buy ingredients like meats, vegetables and rice, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme, de 43 años, es casada y no tiene hijos , vive al lado de su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo de Llerme, consiste en la venta de calzados, durante su tiempo libre, sale a visitar a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para venderles algún calzado de calidad y a la moda como suele ofrecerles. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 05 años y durante este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas que utiliza para mejorar cada día. Cuando no está trabajando en las calles se dedica a vender en su casa. Eventualmente complementa esta actividad con la venta de ropa. Todos los productos que pone a la venta es obtenida mediante compras por catálogo o adquiriéndolos al por mayor de tiendas comerciales que brindan productos de calidad. Trabaja sola y se siente muy cómoda haciéndolo ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de su esposo y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar, le está yendo muy bien, debido a que tiene buenas ventas, pero desea agrandar su negocio extendiendo un espacio de su vivienda. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles, comprará una vitrina y un mostrador de calzados para vender en su casa, además comprará algunas maderas y clavos para agrandar un espacio de su casa y usarlo como tienda de ventas.
texts.en:
Llerme, 43, is married with no children.  She lives with her husband in her own house.  Llerme’s work consists in selling shoes.  She visits friends, neighbors and family members in her free time to sell them quality, stylish shoes.  She’s been doing this for more than five years and has learned many things in this time that she uses to be better every day.  

When she’s not working going from place to place she sells from home.  She sometimes complements this activity with clothing sales.   She gets everything she sells via catalog or buying at wholesale from stores that sell quality products.  She works alone and feels very comfortable doing so for it allows her to have time to spend with her husband and not neglect her household chores.  She’s doing very well because her sales are good but she’d like to enlarge the business extending it into some space at home.

This is her 3rd Kiva loan and she’s grateful to those who make access to credit possible to continue towards her objectives.  She commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy a display case and a counter to sell shoes at home.  She will also buy some lumber and nails to enlarge a space at home to use as a store.

loans.use: to buy shoes and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Saydamir

texts.ru: Сайдамир родился в 1989 года. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Сайдамир спортсмен. Он работает в частном спортзале тренером. Он имеет своих учеников, которые занимаются спортом. Сайдамир в будущем мечтает развевать своё мастерство и участвовать в международных спортивных соревнованиях. Он имеет конкретные цели в жизни и старается реализовать их. Сайдамир имеет большую и дружную семью. Скоро его сестра выходит замуж, и он хочет сделать ей подарок. Сайдамир хочет купить мебель для своей сестры. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки мебели. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Saydamir was born in 1989. He is married, but does not have any children. Saydamir is a sportsman. He works at a private gym as a trainer. He has his members, who do sports. 

Saydamir dreams of developing his skills in the future, and participate in international sports competitions. He has concrete goals in life and tries to realize them. 

Saydamir has a large and friendly family. Soon his sister will get married, and he would like to give her a present. Saydamir hopes to purchase furniture for his sister. He requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase furniture. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture to give his sister for her wedding

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a 32-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and pensioner grandmother in Terjola district. His wife works at a local kindergarten, and gets 200 GEL per month. Akaki is unemployed now. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants make a living. So, Akaki decided to start his business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements.

Akaki received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start a businesses. With the loan of 1,400 GEL, he will purchase building materials and build a greenhouse. He will sow cucumbers and tomatoes there to increase the income of his family. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Luaipoualiki

texts.en: Luaipoualiki is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than ten years. Luaipoualiki has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a spade and a wheelbarrow for her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Luaipoualiki hopes to pay for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling fish in the Philippines. Sylvia has been in this business for 6 years. Sylvia earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: Yessenia, de 25 años, está casada y actualmente está embarazada a la espera de su primer bebé, por el momento vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y sus hermanos de 19 y 15 años, ella junto a sus padres trabajan mucho para poder surgir y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Yessenia consiste en la tapicería. Trabaja en la elaboración o refacción de asientos y toldos de vehículos como motos y mototaxis. Tiene un local en su casa en donde funciona su negocio desde hace 02 años. Cuenta con la ayuda de su padre ya que ambos invirtieron económicamente para emprender este trabajo. A parte de trabajar administrando el negocio familiar también estudia en una universidad de la ciudad aunque ahora por su estado no acude con normalidad. Desea poder seguir adelante para surgir a lado de su familia y ahora más que nada por el bebé que viene en camino. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que como es un negocio familiar puede estar a lado de ellos, además el ingreso económico que percibe es a diario lo cual le permite hacer rotar su dinero con mayor fluidez. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1800 soles, comprará materiales para tapicería, entre ellos esponjas, agujas especiales, hilos, lonas, triplay, pegamentos y otros elementos que se necesita para hacer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 25 years old, is married and currently pregnant waiting for her first baby. At the moment she lives in her parents house, along with her siblings who are 19 and 15 years old. She and her parents work hard in order to have a better quality of life.
