Su esposa es comerciante y tiene un pequeño cafetín en la escuela, en el que vende golosinas. Todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar su venta y tenerla lista para las 7 de la mañana.

Mario es agricultor, oficio que aprendio de su padre, para llegar al lugar donde trabaja, camina 1 kilometro hasta la parcela, trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras su esposa atiende el cafetín de la escuela. Después, de que cada uno termina su jornada da trabajo, cuidan sus animales en un potrero alquilado.

El préstamo sera usado para comprar una vaca lechera, para contribuir a la produccion de leche y los ingresos para la familia.

En un futuro, Mario espera comprar un terreno para tener su animales y no tener que pagar para que le alquilen uno.
texts.en:
Mario, 52, has a spouse and three adult daughters aged between 20 and 25.  He was only able to complete ninth grade.  His wife’s a merchant and has a small snack bar at a school where she sells snacks.  She gets up every morning at 4am to get the things ready to sell at 7am

Mario works in agriculture, an occupation he learned from his father.  To get to his place of work he walks a distance of one kilometer to reach his parcel.  He works all morning while his wife tends to the school snack bar.  Later, when each finishes their work day they care for their animals in a leased pasture.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to add to milk production and increase family income.  In future, Mario hopes to buy land to keep his animals and not have to pay to lease it.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dharmen

texts.en:
Dharmen is 24 years old. He has a family with one child and lives in his parent’s house. 

Dharmen is a rice grower. He inherited a second hand tractor from his father. In 2012, he qualified for a microloan to expand his rice cultivation, which he does on rental plots. He has repaid this loan fully and now he asks for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. His goal is to save for his own rice plots.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Enhbat is 23 years old and lives with his wife and a son in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic yurt in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Buyan-Orshih and he graduated from a local specialized training school together as cobblers. His son Dolgoon is 3 and goes to local kindergarten. 

Enhbat is starting their business of shoe production and sales with his wife. They are talented and entrepreneurial-minded people. They are planning to sell their shoes to countryside herders and other residents and buy or barter livestock with their products. They will sell the livestock in the province center at a higher price and make profit out of their operation and establish a win/win situation for themselves and their clients. 

He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase materials and livestock to start running their business and make a living from it.

loans.use: to purchase materials to start running their business making shoes and trading them with country people for livestock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a man of 39 years, married to Getrude and a father of four. He sells charcoal in Kangemi, and has been in this business for four years. He gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.

This will be David's second loan with Kadet Ltd; he plans to buy sacks of charcoal so that he can meet the demand. 

He wants to expand business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single lady of thirty and she supports two children. Mary sells animal feed and agro-vet products. She has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 11,900 shillings.

This will be Mary's first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feed for sale and animal medicines. In future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 51-year-old married woman. She has had a business of milk selling for many years. She collects the milk from the cows and buffaloes early in the morning, and then she sells it to the people of her community. She is also doing a side business of cultivating different seasonal crops and vegetables. Shama is trying hard to fulfill her family demands, including food, health and  clothing. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers and has therefore requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy one more cow. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, and is currently in her fifth loan cycle. 

She wishes to earn more profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a car to run his small business more effectively

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is a 27 year old married woman and a mother of two. She has been in the business of milk selling for the past 3 years. She has 1 buffalo. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Iram has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have an increase in production capacity of milk which would ultimately help her in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Kombelwa

texts.en:
Kombelwa is 24 years old and lives in the town of Chambeshi, which is located in the Copperbelt Province of northern Zambia.  She lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter in a one-bedroom house.  Her husband works as an underground miner.  

Kombelwa has set up a Zoona mobile money transfer business to help provide for her family.  Her husband does not earn much income at his job so Kombelwa has taken the initiative to start her own business to provide additional income for the family.  Kombelwa is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth for her business.  Currently, she does not own a booth and does not have the necessary capital to purchase one without a loan. She will use the rest of the loan as working capital for her shop so that she can serve more customers

Kombelwa has big aspirations for her family’s future.  Her goal is to grow the business and become a successful businesswoman who earns a stable income.  This will enable her to take control of providing for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth for her business and increase her working capital float

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is a 34 year old woman. She has 1 child aged 15 years. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a milk shop where she sells milk. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are the general public. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more milk for resale. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mr.Oyunchimeg is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Tuul, is currently unemployed and takes care of their 3 children under 7.

Oyunchimeg has been driving a heavy vehicle for years, and used to provide transportation services by renting the truck. He has just bought the old Russian truck for his business, and finally is running his own transportation business. 

He is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to fix his truck, and start providing transportation service between and within towns. 

He is a man who enjoys driving his truck, and working for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to fix his truck and start providing a transportation service between and within towns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
Tránsito, mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy humilde de 56 años de edad, nació en Tanicuhí, un pequeño lugar en la provincia de Cotopaxi perteneciente a la república del Ecuador vive en su casita propia que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró hacer ya desde hace unos 20 años, tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad y que no viven con ella.
Desde muy niña aprendió el oficio de la agricultura por sus padres, y ha tenido de trabajar de sol a sol ya que la situación económica nunca fue buena, tuvieron que pasar muchas necesidades, sus padres nunca le dieron educación y Tránsito hoy en  día es analfabeta, por esta razón se le ha dificultado realizar algún trámite legal, bancario o personal, para lo cual ha tenido que respaldarse con su hijo quien tiene un poder otorgado por su madre para poder representarla en cualquier trámite.
Tránsito se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y animales menores desde hace más de 20 años, siendo esta actividad lo que le ha brindado la oportunidad de salir adelante con sus hijos, la señora es muy reconocida en su localidad por ser una mujer trabajadora.
Por el momento Tránsito no está muy bien de salud y se le ha dificultado el tener que salir y transportar sus animales de un lugar a otro, por esta razón ha visto la necesidad de quedarse en casa cuidando animalitos como pollos, cuyes, borregos y cerdos,  visitó Fundación Alternativa con la intención de solicitar un crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, la misma que le generará mayor utilidad pero sobre todo ya no tendrá que salir a las diferentes  plazas. Tránsito quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Tránsito’s a hardworking, enterprising, very humble 56-year-old woman.  She was born in Tanicuhí, a small place in Cotopaxi Province in the Republic of Ecuador.  She lives in her own house which she managed to build with much effort and sacrifice 20 years ago.  She has three adult children that no longer live with her.

She learned agriculture from her parents while still a young girl and has had to work from sun to sun because the economic situation was never good.  They had to suffer many needs and her parents never sent her to school so to this day Tránsito is illiterate.  Because of this, legal, banking or personal transactions have always been difficult and she’s had to rely on her son who has a power of attorney from her to represent her in any transaction.

Tránsito’s business for more than 20 years has been buying and selling cattle and small animals.  This activity has made it possible for her to get ahead with her children.  She’s very well-known in her community for being a hardworking woman.

At present, Tránsito is in poor health and it’s been difficult for her to go out to transport her animals from one place to another which has led her to have to stay home caring for her small animals like chickens, guinea pigs, sheep and pigs.  

She visited Fundación Alternativa to request a loan to buy a dairy cow that will generate higher profits but above all will allow her to stop having to go to various market places.  

Tránsito wants to extend a sincere thanks and congratulations to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making her personal and business growth possible.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 37-year-old married woman. She is been in business selling goats for the past three years. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her family of seven members. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to let them lead a decent life. 

Salma buys baby goats at low prices, raises them, and then sells them near the occasion of the feast of Eid-ul-Azha. She took loans for the betterment of her business and to increase her livestock. Now she is requesting Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan is a private entrepreneur from Ejmiadsin city in the Armavir region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and her 85-year-old mother-in-law. 

Ruzan has run a local store for seven years. She sells grocery products, fruits and vegetables. Ruzan's husband assists her greatly in the organizational issues of her small business, which is the family's only source of income. 

Ruzan's small business needs some investments to become more compatible and to function in a sustainable way. Ruzan needs a loan of $3,000 (US) to purchase new products to sell in the store. By expanding the assortment of goods, Ruzan hopes to increase her sales and develop her small business further. 

She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping her sustain her small business.

loans.use: to purchase new products to sell in the store

loans.name: Shazadain

texts.en: Shazadain deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 53-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for 20 years. They have two buffaloes in milk and sell their milk to their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffalos and collects the milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

Irshad has six children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make larger profits, Irshad has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been doing a business of clothes sales for many years. She sells the clothes to the people of her community and in the market. She also stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason Abida has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy some cloth, spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and selling clothes.

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Oquendo Group

texts.es: Delsy es  intégrate del grupo “TRIUNFADORAS DE OQUENDO”  la alcancía está conformada por 07 socias.Delsy  es casada y tiene 02 hijos, ella se dedica al negocio del  transporte básicamente alquiler de taxi empezó con un carro, gracias  a su esfuerzo y el de su esposo han podido comprar más carros en la actualidad tienen 04 unidades .Delsy se encarga de la parte administrativa y gracias a su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de estudios que sus hijos requieren, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá para el mantenimiento de sus carros de esa manera estarán operativos para seguir trabajando. Más adelante quiere aumentar su capital y adquirir otra unidad. Delsy y todo su grupo agradecen a los inversionistas KIVA. En la foto está sentada viste casaca color roja.
texts.en: Delsy’s a member of the “Triunfadoras de Oquendo” (Oquendo Winners) communal bank consisting of seven members.  Delsy’s married with two children and works providing transportation services; basically taxi rentals.  She started out with one car and thanks to her and her husband’s efforts has been able to buy more cars and at present has four.  Delsy takes care of the administrative side and thanks to her work is able to cover her children’s schooling costs.  The loan she’s asked for will be used to service the cars so that they will be in operating condition and able to continue working.  Later on she wants to increase capital and buy another car.  Delsy and her entire group thank Kiva lenders.  In the photo, she’s seated wearing a red jacket.

loans.use: to service her taxis.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single lady of twenty six years. She supports one person, and makes her living selling beauty products in Kiambu. Alice has been in this business for four years and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenyan shillings.

This will be Alice's third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of beauty products for her business. In the future, she hopes to be prosperous in business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de su crédito Buena Esperanza está formado por 9 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en la parroquia la Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural, de un clima frió y de una verde vegetación, sus tierras son fértiles y propicias para la ganadería. Las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, son personas amables y gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Narcisa, este su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus compañeras del grupo de crédito Buena Esperanza, le gusta esta forma de crédito porque le da la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y al mismo tiempo que fortalecen los lasos de amistad con todas las socias y vecinas.
La Señora Narcisa tiene 39 años de edad, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 17, 14, 9, 7 y 3 años, su primer hijo pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres de su hogar, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. 
Doña Narcisa pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa, existen días que labora como jornalera, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la venta de la leche, también cría abejas y cuyes. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera. 
 Su meta es crecer aun más en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) communal bank consists of 11 members, nine women and 2 men, living in Cuenca’s La Victoria del Protete parish, a place that enjoys natural beauty, cold climate, green vegetation.   Its land is fertile and apt for raising cattle.  The members are woman who strive daily to improve their homes’ economic stability.  They are kind, gracious people who still retain the culture and traditions of their peoples.

One of the group members is Narcisa.  This is the third loan she’s taken out with her fellow Buena Esperanza members.  She likes this way of getting credit because it gives her the opportunity to invest in her business while at the same time strengthening the bonds of friendship among her neighbors and fellow members.

Narcisa is 39-years-old and separated from her husband but she has five children who are 17, 14, 9, 7 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest son stays home to help her with chores, her second daughter attends secondary school and the next two attend the local primary school.

Narcisa spends most of her time at home.  There are days that she works as a day laborer.  She raises cattle at home and sells milk.  She also raises bees and guinea pigs.  

The loan money will be used to buy a dairy cow.  Her goal is to grow still more in her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a private entrepreneur from Yerevan city. She lives with her husband and her parents-in-law. Her husband works for the police. 

Liana runs a small local grocery store, where she sells different products for everyday demand. She and her husband work hard to be able to earn a living. Currently, Liana's small business needs some investment in order for it to be compatible and function in a sustainable way. 

Liana needs a loan of USD 3,000 to expand the assortment of goods she sells in her store, as well as to buy refrigerators for several products. 

The loan will be a huge support for this hard-working woman, and will help her develop her small business further. 

Liana relies on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be very thankful to them for helping her sustain her business.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of goods and to buy refrigerators for several products

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 33 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses in a timely fashion. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for stitching clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, spare parts, and other materials for his auto repair business, and to pay his children's living expense at the university

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a lady of thirty nine years, married to Nelson, and a mother of two children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for the last six years. Margaret gets a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. She wants to buy more cows in future as well as educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carol Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carol es una joven de 22 años que trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad y con los ingresos que obtiene de su humilde trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de crianza de patos; Carol cree que le va bien porque es muy trabajadora y luchadora.

Carol agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar materiales para construir jaulas para patos como maderas, palos plásticos,  bebederos, cañas, entre otros, así podrá mejorar en su negocio y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” apoyar a su familia a salir adelante”.
texts.en: Carol is a young woman of 22, who works as an agricultural worker on a farm that belongs to the city. The income she receives from her modest position allows her to help with the household expenses. At the same time, with a good deal of effort, she has been able to start a business raising ducks. Carol believes things are going well for her due to her hard-work and struggle. Carol is grateful for the support she receives from the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to their help she can buy the materials like wood, plastic sticks, drinking receptacles, canes, etc. to built cages for the ducks. With this she can improve her business and fight to make her dream a reality: "help her family get ahead".

loans.use: to buy material to build cages.

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es:
Juana tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya son adolescentes y a quienes saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo y por ello trabaja como obrera de un fundo agrícola, Juana se esfuerza mucho y es por ello que cree que está saliendo adelante. 

Juana esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como triplay y drywall para poder construir un cuarto y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida., asi podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa construida de material noble”.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, is mother of two children who are adolescents and who she supports with much effort working as a day laborer on a large agricultural estate.  Juana works hard and that’s why she thinks she’s getting ahead.

Juana’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy plywood and drywall to build a room and improve her quality of life and continue striving to make her great dream reality: to build her house out of substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Gumbat

texts.en: Gumbat is a 55-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and son in a small village of the Marneuli district. Gumbat works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing tomatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only seasonal income, Gumbat decided to start dairy farming and sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1500 Gel for purchasing calves. After the calves are purchased the family will raise them and will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They will also use the milk products for feeding the family. The new business initiative will give them a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes is an experienced agronomist from the village Tsaghkasar in the Aragatsotn region. He is also the head of the village self-governance body. He lives with his wife and two school-aged sons. To cover his family's daily expenses, Hovhannes is engaged in breeding cows, sheep, and hens. He also cultivates barley. Farming is the most important source of income for the family. Hovhannes's wife helps him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. As life is getting more expensive with time, Hovhannes needs to slightly increase his number of livestock to be able to meet the increasing needs of his family more effectively. A loan of 2500 USD will be a huge support to Hovhannes and his family, enabling them to purchase two cows and some forage for the livestock. The family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed amount for the loan to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 39-year-old married man. He has 12 children. He describes himself as motivated. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area that is good for the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own ten motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 43 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school. With her husband, she operates a business selling milk, butter, and cheese, which she has been doing for four years. She has one cow in milk and sells her products to many of her neighbors.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.  

Fozia is requesting her fourth loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more more cow. She needs to earn more money to meet everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. The new cow will help her to increase her sales, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ghulam  Aysha

texts.en:
Ghulam Aysha is 37 years old, a married lady and a mother of three. She has been involved in a business of animal sales for about ten years. Her husband is a laborer, so the household expenditures are difficult to manage with his low income.  She is supporting her husband financially to meet their basic needs.  

At present, she has one buffalo, one cow and four goats. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs.35, 000 to purchase two more calves. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Jacquelin Del Carmen

texts.es: Jacqueline habita en Managua, es madre soltera, procreadora de tres hijos, todos en edad escolar y universitaria. A pesar que ella trabaja, su salario no alcanza para cubrir todas necesidades básicas de su familia, especialmente la educación de sus hijos, desde hace algunos meses ha trabajado en otras alternativas de ingresos que puedan ayudarle. Jacqueline solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio que tiene establecido en su casa, ella tiene pensado comprar ropa de cama, toallas, materiales plásticos del hogar, productos de uso personal, vajillas, termos entre otros, considerando que puede aumentar la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en: Jacqueline lives in Managua and is a single mother of three school and college aged children. Despite the fact that she works, her salary is not enough to cover her family's basic needs, particularly her children's education. For the last few months, Jacqueline has been working in a variety of environments to make money that will be able to help her. Jacqueline is requesting this loan to stock the business that she has established at her home. She plans to buy bedding, towels, plastics, personal products, tableware, thermoses and other items. She believes that these products can increase demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy bedding, towels, plastics, personal products, tableware and thermoses.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 32, lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her mini-supermarket, which sells essential items like bread and milk. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more commodities to sell in the supermarket and will help Sarah generate greater profits and meet some of her family's basic needs. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. This program primarily serves small-enterprise entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell in her supermarket.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock from herders for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is a 51-year-old mother from Kibuye in Kisumu county. She is married to Walter who is also a business man. She supports six people in her family.

Seline has a tailoring center where she makes and sells clothing. She has been doing this business for the last 20 years and gets a monthly income of KES 50,000. Seline is requesting a loan with KADET, which she will use to add more stock of clothing materials for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to stabilize her business.

Her dream is to educate her children and be financially stable in this business.

loans.use: to add stock of clothing materials.

loans.name: Caritas Alegres  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Caritas Alegres está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser cuan de grandes deportistas y artistas, se encentra bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente al igual que todas las socias son mujeres luchadoras, que buscan día a día mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Fanny, este es su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Caritas Alegres, se integro a este grupo ya que una de sus compañeras de trabajo formaba parte y le invito, le gusta esta actividad ya que todas forman un hermoso grupo a mas que comparten mas como compañeras  amigas.
La Señora Fanny es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 12, 8, 4, 2 y 1 año, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Fanny trabaja en un mercado de la ciudad, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de pollos pelados, negocio que le da la oportunidad de salir adelante con sus hijos.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos pelados para la venta.
Su meta es darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Caritas Alegres” (Cheerful Faces) communal bank consists of seven women living around the city of Cuenca.  This well-known city is famous as the birthplace of great sports figures and artists.  It’s bathed by four rivers and since December, 1999, has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  Its residents as well as all the group members are hard-working women who seek daily to improve their homes’ economic stability and provide better futures for their children.

One of the members of this group is Fanny.  This is her second loan alongside her friends and fellow Caritas Alegres group members.  She joined the group because one of her fellow members was a in it and invited her to join.  She likes this activity because they are a beautiful group and they share as friends and companions.

Fanny’s a single mother of five children who are 12, 8, 4, 2 and 1 years of age.  Her oldest two attend the local school.  She does not own a house; she’s a renter.

Fanny has worked in a city market selling butchered chickens.  This business has given her the ability to move her children forward.  She will use the loan money to buy dressed chickens to sell.  Her goal is to give her children a good education so they can become good professionals.

The small photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy butchered chickens.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 51-year-old milk vendor. He is married to Njeri, a farmer, and together they are blessed with two children. Fredrick has been selling milk for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 27,000 which he uses to sustain his family. 

Fredrick is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to increase the quantity of milk from the suppliers. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business to wholesale and pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a well profitable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of milk from the suppliers.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 23-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers variety of things such as hair bands, clips, jewelery items, etc. at reasonable prices.  She has retained a good number of customers in the two years of her business, and makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000; she will use this to buy packs of hair pins, bracelets, and hair ponies in different colors from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Samina wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair pins, bracelets, and hair ponies in different colors.

loans.name: Ngwa Christina

texts.en:
Ngwa Christina is married and a mother of five children. They live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in life, including sickness, early marriage, and the death of a loved one; she had to drop out of school due to the death of her brother who had been supporting her financially, and she had inadequate finances to start a business of her own and cater to her family's needs.

With the new loan she has requested, Ngwa Christina will expand her business, buying more items in bulk, like rice, groundnuts, tomatoes, sweets, smoked fish, and magi. She will also increase her farm size and buy more piglets.  She is positive about this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and has regular customers who buy her products, especially pigs, for which the demand is high. With this added business activity, the community will also benefit because she is selling her rice, groundnuts, and tomatoes at moderate prices, and the distance to buy from the market will reduce. The community also benefits from the manure from her pigs.

With the profit from this loan, Ngwa Christina will cater to her family's needs, ensure that her children are educated, and provide medication when needs arise. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: buy items to sell, like rice, groundnuts, and seedlings, and also purchase more piglets for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase forage and materials to build a barn for poultry farming

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old, married, and  has two children. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables, which she has been doing for four years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to support her business. 

Lucy is requesting her fourth loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to add stocks of tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables

loans.name: Santa Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carme se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de  esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y el último  de 13 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Santa realiza el crédito  para ayudarle a su esposo con su negocio y con esto contribuir de una forma a sacar adelante a su familia, el se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual tres veces por semana en la madrugada el se desplaza hasta las playas de Manta para comprar el mejor pescado a pescadores que llegan hasta este lugar, luego de limpiarlos los envía a la ciudad de Quito lugar donde vive un hermano que es quien se encarga distribuir en esa linda ciudad. Llevan más de 10 años en este negocio y les ha ido bien hasta la fecha ya que cada día tienen más clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses y con esto se ayudan mucho. 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para llevar el pescado en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The "María Del Carme" communal bank gets together every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi. This city is known for the Panama hat, it's cool climate and the many natural tourist attractions in the area.

Santa lives here. She is 47 years old, married and has four children from this relationship, three of them now adults. Their youngest is 13 years old and studies at a secondary school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Santa is requesting this loan to help her husband with his business and contribute in this way to helping the family get ahead. Her husband sells fish. Early in the morning three times a week he goes to the beaches of Manta to purchase the best fish from the fishermen who come there. Then he cleans them and sends them to Quito. A brother of his lives there and he distributes the fish in that beautiful city. They have been in the business for over 10 years. Things have been going well for them up to now and they get more clients day by day. This loan is to buy more fish. 

Santa has been a member of this communal bank since it's initiation. She likes it as the loans have very low interest rates and therefore help a lot. Her dream is to buy a truck in order to ship greater quantities of fish to the capital.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 37-year-old married man. He is married to Elizabeth, who is a housewife. Together they are blessed with three children.

To earn a living, Christopher runs a clinic and a laboratory. Christopher has been running his clinic and laboratory for the past five years. By doing so, he is able to earn a monthly income of approximately 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

Christopher is applying for his first loan term with KADET. He will use the requested loan proceeds to purchase medicine and other chemicals for the laboratory. With the profits he expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan he plans on educating his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and other chemicals for his clinic and laboratory

loans.name: Abib

texts.en:
Abib is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, Ishaka Branch, having borrowed five times from the same institution. He is 64 years of age and a farmer, dealing in tea-growing. He is a married man and has six children who all go to school. 

Abib works five days on the tea farm and he works four hours per day, on average. In addition to tea farming, he also has a retail shop which gives him additional income to support his family. 

Abib started farming in 2000 with a motive of earning income to support his family and he has not turned back since then. He does this in Nyamiko-Kigoma and he has now applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 which he hopes to use to buy fertilizer to put in his garden, so that he can have better harvests and, hence, more income. 

His clients are tea traders in his home area and the Igara Tea Factory. Abib says his major challenge is the unfavorable weather which affects his tea product, but he believes that, if given the loan and if he keeps being the honest person he has always been, he will do better and will achieve much from tea-farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Henry has been working hard to manage his video library, which sells video movies and music. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will allow Henry to stock more video movies and CDs to sell and will help him to generate greater profits, so that he can complete his residential house and send his siblings to better schools. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a video cinema. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more videos and CDs to sell.

loans.name: Tseelei

texts.en:
Tseelei is a 61-year-old widow living with her 2 children in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son, Tulga, has graduated from the local university and started a transportation service business. This year, her daughter, Todhaan, has enrolled in the university in Ulaanbaatar. 

Tseelei has been working as saleswoman for years and is just now starting to rent the grocery store to provide her own business to her clients. She is a welcoming and helpful woman who pleases her clients with good food and service. She is now requesting 3,250,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of food inventory for her newly operating grocery store business.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of food inventory for her newly operating grocery store business.

loans.name: Priscila Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Priscila,  tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años que están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Priscila es una muy buena ama de casa que además de estar atenta del cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa por catálogo, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas)  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y a cada lugar que va lleva su revista la misma que muestra a sus clientes para que escojan lo que deseen, luego ella hace los pedidos entrega y cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, zapatos y los productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Priscila, 38, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 14 and 9 years of age attending school; her eldest is in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Priscila’s a very good housewife who in addition to caring for her home is also a merchant.  She sells clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) via catalog door to door.  She shows her catalogs to customers everywhere she visits so they can choose what they want.  They place orders and she delivers them and collects every 8 days since she sells her goods on credit.  She’s been practicing this profession for more than 15 years and it’s helped her move her children forward.

The loan is to buy clothes, costume jewelry, shoes and Yanbal products.  She’s been in the communal bank for 14 years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, costume jewelry, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three children in a small village in the Marneuli district of Georgia. Roman is actively involved in agricultural activities. He has 2.5 hectare plot of land, where maize is grown; the family also has a greenhouse where they grow cucumbers and tomatoes. Roman is a very hardworking man and always has high-quality products, which he sells to local retailers. 

Roman has decided to start an additional business, and he has requested a loan to do so. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to receive a loan of $3000 for purchasing three cows. As the cows are purchased, his wife will milk them every day and will produce dairy products to sell. This will increase their income and give them a chance to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of mobile phone chargers, batteries and other accessories.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old and married to Samuel, who also brings in additional income through subsistence farming. Together, they are blessed with two children aged 23 and 5 years. Esther has done business for 8 years, vending milk and also selling cereals. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Esther will use the amount borrowed of KES 60,000 to buy more milk and cereals like maize for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business on school fees for her children as well as repaying her loan.

loans.use: to buy more milk and maize for resale.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun viven con ella, su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña María junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos compran y venden pescado, para lo cual cuatro veces por semana se desplaza su esposos hasta las playas de la ciudad de Manta para comprar el mejor pescado,  luego lo limpian y lo envían a Quito, ciudad en la cual vive un hijo que es el encargado de recibir y vender el producto, llevan en este negocio  más de 20 años con el cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal  desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante  a sus hijos. 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

María, 62, lives here.  She’s married and has six adult children one of which still lives with her.  Her husband’s a merchant.

María and her husband are merchants.  They buy and sell fish.  To do so, she and her husband head out to the beaches in the city of Manta four times a week to buy the best fish that they then clean and send to Quito, the city their son lives in where he receives and sells it.  They’ve been in this business more than 20 years and it’s made it possible for her to move her family forward.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  She’s been in the communal bank since the start and likes it because she’s been able to move her children ahead thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Génesis Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Génesis,  tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 2 años. Su esposo es comerciante de pescado.
Doña Génesis  es una gran madre y esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su marido,  él se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual recorre en un carro la localidad y lugares cercanos ofreciendo sus productos. Mientras su marido se dedica a esto ella también por su parte se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a la vez que realiza cortes y pintado  de uñas. Lleva más de 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad y su marido mucho más. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pescado y cosméticos que ella vende. Lleva más de 2 años en él  Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para realizar los créditos.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que nunca les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Génesis, 20, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a two-year-old son.  Her husband’s a fish merchant.

Génesis is a great wife and mother who takes out the loans to help her husband.  He sells fish.  To do so, he goes throughout the zone and nearby areas in his car offering his products.  While her husband does this, she on her part sells cosmetics and provides manicures.  She’s been in her activity for more than three years and her husband has been in his for much longer.

The loan will be used to buy fish and to buy the cosmetics she sells.  She’s been in the communal bank more than two years and likes it because of the ease in getting the loans.  Her dream is to continue forward and that her family lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy fish and cosmetics.

loans.name: Al-Rafa Group

texts.en:
The Al-Rafa Group consists of three members, all female. From Sana'a, Yemen, they know each other very well because they have lived in the same neighborhood for a long time. All their projects are home-based. They have many clients, however, mostly women. 

The group has taken out a loan of 150,000 Yemeni rials through group lending, which the Al-Amal Microfinance Bank offers to women who cannot provide guarantees. The group leader, Haya, who is 36 years old, acquired her dressmaking skills long ago. Her main business is sewing and, due to her good reputation, she has a woman to help her with her sewing. When her clients are getting married or having a party, they come to her to sew their gowns. 

Haya will use her portion of the loan to purchase textiles, dresses and other basic materials needed for sewing. In the future, she plans to open a big tailoring shop to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, dresses and other basic materials needed for sewing.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a vigorous 34-year-old woman. She is very hardworking and has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothes in various materials, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough income through her business. 

Khalida is requesting a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers. She is currently in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent credit behavior. Khalida expects a boost in her earnings from her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Ganbaatar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian tent home) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His two older children are both university students and the youngest daughter goes to kindergarten. Ganbaatar is a hardworking and enthusiastic man. He and his wife have been running a butcher shop at a rental counter in their local market since 2003. Ganbaatar has built a regular client base for the business and is well known for his quality, tasty meat and friendly and convenient service. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik to pay his children's tuition and also purchase meat inventory from herders.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition and also purchase meat inventory from herders.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She isa  nice woman of 64 years. Gohar lives with her granddaughter. Her husband died several years ago and her daughter is temporally abroad. Her granddaughter is a student of Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of History and Jurisprudence. She studies at the paid division and her grandmother Gohar pays for her tuition fee. It has been ten years that Gohar has been running her own clothes trading business. In the center of their city Gohar has a shop where she sells women's and men's clothes, women's bags and clutch bags. The income from her business she tries to divide into equal parts so as to keep their living conditions just on a minimum level.   
Gohar asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of autumn-winter clothes for a new collection and to enlarge both her business and family income.

loans.use: To buy a lot of autumn-winter new collection of clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 42 year old married woman. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are students and parents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds . She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of threads and other tailoring materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 45,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of threads and other tailoring materials for making clothes

loans.name: Segundo Tomas

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive el señor Segundo, tiene 59 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
Don Segundo se dedica a la venta de pescado, él  se desplaza en la madrugada hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el pescado para luego embarcarlo en un carro que alquila y llevarlo a vender en su ciudad, en ciertas ocasiones viajan a cantones aledaños a entregar al por mayor a comerciantes, trabaja solo y en ciertas ocasiones su esposa le acompaña, lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 30 años y le ha ido muy bien. 
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 
Su sueño es comprar un carro propio para no pagar arriendo que se le lleva gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Segundo, 59, lives here.  He’s married and has four adult children.  His wife’s a housewife.

Segundo works selling fish.  He heads out to the city of Manta at dawn to buy fish that he ships in a car he leases to take it to sell in his city.  Occasionally he visits nearby cantons to sell to merchants at wholesale.  He works alone and sometimes his wife goes with him.  He’s been in this business for more than 30 years and has done very well.

He will use the loan to buy fish.  He’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  His dream is to buy a car of his own and save leasing costs that consume much of his profits.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Daysi Tatiana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 26 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene dos niñas de 11 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Daysi realiza el crédito  para ayudarle a su esposo con su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de pescado, todos los días en la madrugada se desplaza hasta las playas de Manta para comprar el mejor pescado para luego llevarlo a Montecristi, lugar que recorre en un triciclo para poder vender todo lo que lleva y con esto lograr ganar lo suficiente para que no falte nada en el hogar. El  lleva más de 15 años en este negocio el cual es duro pero que le da para salir adelante honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 
Su sueño es que su esposo compre un carro para que realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Daysi, 26, lives here.  She’s married and has two daughters who are 11 and 6 years old attending secondary and elementary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Daysi is taking out the loan to help with her husband’s business.  He works selling fish.  He heads out to the beaches in the city of Manta every day at dawn to buy the best fish to take to Montecristi.  He goes through it on his three-wheeled vehicle to sell everything he takes and earn enough to insure his home lacks nothing.  He’s been in this business more than 15 years and although it’s hard work it’s a way of earning a life honestly.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is that her husband buys a car for his sales.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is from the village of Charnali, near the city of Batumi, Georgia. She is a 19-year-old single woman with a great desire to get ahead. She lives with her parents and sister and runs a small-scale agricultural business with her family members. They grow and sell potatoes, citrus, and various vegetables. Madona's father works as a supervisor at the Batumi boulevard and gets a monthly salary there. 

The family income is too small to save and improve their standard of living. Madona has applied for this loan in order to rent a section at the local shopping center and purchase a supply of merchandise to sell at a mark-up, such as purses, sunglasses, watches, jewellery, etc. Madona will work as a salesperson herself and will be very nice to her customers.

This Start-up loan is a good chance for Madona to earn a stable income and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to rent a section in the local shopping center and purchase stock of merchandise such as purses, sunglasses, watches, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 37-year-old single woman. She has two children, ages four and twelve, and describes herself as motivated. For four years, she has operated a general store, where she sells sugar, washing soap, maize flour, and other household items. Her business is located in a strategic place.  She identifies her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add stock of sugar, maize flour, washing soap, and other items to her store. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of sugar, maize flour, washing soap and other items for her store.

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Karla, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Karla junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de artesanías propias de la zona como son las hamacas, las perezosas de madera y mimbre, productos que son muy solicitado en otras ciudades a las que viajan para entregar estos productos, ellos una vez por semana se desplazan a Quito, Machala, Guayaquil e inclusive han llevado hasta el vecino país Perú lugar donde venden a muy buen precio estos productos. Ellos entregan sus productos y se quedan dos o tres días hasta que cobren lo entregado, luego regresan a su ciudad para prepararse para la semana siguiente,  llevan más de 10 años en este  negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.  
Este crédito es para comprar hamacas, perezosas y otras artesanías que venden. Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda. 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos y vender con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Karla, 23, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 7 and 5 years old.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Karla and her husband sell crafts like hammocks and wood and wicker beach chairs that are typical of the zone and are in high demand in other cities that they travel to to sell them.  They go to Quito, Machala and Guayaquil once a week and have even gone as far as neighboring Peru where they sell these products at very good prices.  They sell them and remain there for two or three days until they collect what’s owed them and then they return home to get ready for the next week.  They’ve been in this business more than ten years now and it makes it possible for them to get ahead.

This loan is to buy hammocks, beach chairs and other crafts they sell.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the help.  Her dream is to buy a car to transport their products and sell them more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, beach chairs and other crafts..

loans.name: Suad Group

texts.en: The Suad group consists of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the total amount of 90,000 YER from AMB. Nadia, 39 years old, is a married woman with four children. She is illiterate and lives with her children in a small house. She works very hard to provide her family with everything they need, but what she earns is really not enough. For four years, she has been a door-to-door clothes and cosmetics seller. To date she has earned good profits, and she now wants to expand her business which would enable her to earn more money. As a result, she applied for a loan to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business. She is very ambitious and loves her family very much. Going forward, she wants to educate her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en:
Nazeer, 42, is married and the mother of five children. She has run a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloths in her community. 

Nazeer has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees from Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving her children a good, quality education through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Bran

texts.en:
Bran is 46 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children with five of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Bran has been working hard to manage his small retail shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Bran has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new clothes to sell, and will help Bran to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Bran hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Bran is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bran who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to sell,

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has had a business for many years selling goods like toys and cosmetics door to door. Her husband was previously the only earner for the family, and it was very tough for Shameem to manage their daily household expenses with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband by earning additional money and is now playing a very important role in her family. She has requested a loan of 30,000 rupees to purchase more toys, such as cars, balls, and bears, in order to meet the demand of her customers. She is currently in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown a good repayment behavior in past. Shameem desires to expand her business and intends to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more toys such as cars, balls and bears.

loans.name: Mzisadar

texts.en:
Mzisadar, age 63, lives in the village of Zemo Nagvazao with her son and daughter-in-law. The main source of income for the family is the small grocery store where Mzisadar works as a saleslady. She serves her customers all day long with love and care. 
Mzisadar also owns a cow that produces dairy products for selling as well as for the family's consumption.
Now, Mzisadar is requesting a loan to start a gift store in her village center in order to generate more income. 
According her estimations, the business can earn her a good income and her villagers will be interested in shopping there as there is not a similar shop nearby. 
Mzisadar is happy for start-up program that gives poor people a chance to start and develop businesses.
She hopes Kiva lenders will be helpful for her family.

loans.use: to start up a gift store in her village

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años que están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña Cruz es una muy buena ama de casa que además de estar atenta en el cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa por catálogo, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas)  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y a cada lugar que va lleva su revista la misma que muestra a sus clientes para que escojan lo que deseen, luego ella hace los pedidos entrega y cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, zapatos y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

Cruz, 38, lives here.  She’s married and has two children aged 14 and 9 years attending school; the eldest in secondary school and the youngest in elementary school.  Her husband’s a driver.

Cruz is a very good housewife who in addition to caring for her home is also a merchant.  She sells clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) via catalog door to door.  She takes her catalogs to every place she visits to show her customers.  They choose what they want and place orders she delivers and collects every 8 days since she sells on credit.  

This loan is to buy clothes, costume jewelry, shoes and Yanbal products.  She’s been in the communal bank 14 years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: María Holanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña María realiza el crédito  para ayudarle a su esposo con su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de pescado  en un mercado de Manta, vende al por mayor y al menudeo a las personas que día a día llegan hasta este lugar para abastecerse de productos para el sustento diario, el trabaja todos los días desde la madrugada que se desplaza hasta las playas de Manta para comprar directo a los pescadores y luego llevar a dicho mercado donde distribuye sus productos, lleva más de 22 años en este negocio con el cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, y le gusta por los beneficios que le ha dado la institución. 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para transportar sus productos ya que alquilan transporte todos los días.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from.  It’s a cold climate city with many natural tourist attractions.

María, 51, lives here.  She’s married and has three adult children but two of them who are attending university still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

María is taking out the loan to help her husband’s business.  He works selling fish in a market in Manta.  He sells wholesale and retail to people who come by day to day to stock up on this daily sustenance product.  He works every day starting at dawn when he heads to the beaches in Manta to buy fish directly from fishermen and then take it to the market where he sells it.  He’s been in business more than 22 years and support his family this way.

This loan is to buy fish.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the benefits the institution has given her.  Her dream is to buy a truck to transport the products since they have to lease transportation every day.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo. 
Asya is a 32-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Asya's husband is an employee in the public sector where he earns a very low wage. This wage is not enough to cover all the family's needs. He also works in an Internet cafe he owns and he sells computer accessories. It is a very simple business and needs a lot of improvements. 
Asya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more products for his store to resell. This will improve his store and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more products for her husband's store to resell

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 35-year-old married man from Ramallah city. He is a father of two boys and one daughter. Basel is an employee in a ministry in Ramallah. He gets a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Basel also works at a kindergarten he has owned for seven years. He is a very ambitious man despite a disability in his legs
Basel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy educational toys for the kindergarten. This will improve his business and also his income. 
Basel appears in the photo in a graduation party for the kids.

loans.use: to buy educational toys for the kindergarten

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is married and has three children. He operates a tire repair service, which he has been doing for 13 years. Near the house where he lives with his family, he owns a small place where he repairs tires. Over years of hard and dedicated work, Yurik has gained many customers who value the quality of the work that he provides. As the family's only breadwinner, he does his best to be able to cover his family’s' daily costs. 

Yurik is requesting a loan from SEF International, which he will use to purchase a stock of tires.
