He loan is part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, which provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a  Kiva borrower. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 27 years. She describes herself as creative. She operates a boutique where she sells flowers, pillows and other house decorating materials. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of flowers, pillows and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of flowers, pillows and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 57-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 18 to 30 years. She describes herself as creative. She has rental houses where tenants pay rent. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She also does farming to earn extra income. Her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets, nails, timber etc. to build more rental houses.  She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy iron sheets, nails, timber etc. to build more rental houses

loans.name: Banco Mujer Ditsöwo Group

texts.es: Elizabeth es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Ditsöwö, un grupo de mujeres de indígenas de la zona de Talamanca. Esta mujer tan trabajadora tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3, uno de ellos en la escuela primaria y 2 en secundaria. Su compañero trabaja como agricultor en una pequeña finca, su salario es mínimo, por ello Elizabeth busca la forma de aportar para cubrir los gastos familiares y se dedica a la cría de pollos de engorde, que los vende entre sus vecinos. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimentos, concentrados, y vitaminas. Esta inyección de capital va ser de mucha ayuda para aumentar su producción. Su plan a futuro es seguir cubriendo los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos. Junto a Elizabeth están 7 socias más q ue van a invertir en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth’s president of the Ditsöwö communal bank, a group of indigenous women from the Talamanca zone.  This very hardworking woman is 35-years-old and in a common law relationship.  She has three children; one in elementary school and two in secondary.  Her spouse works as a laborer on a small farm earning minimum wage which is why Elizabeth seeks ways to contribute towards family expenses.  

She works raising chickens to sell among her neighbors.  This is her second loan and she will use it to buy chicks, feed, concentrate and vitamins.  This injection of capital will be of much help for her to increase production.  Her plan for the future is to continue covering her children’s schooling costs.  

There are seven additional members with Elizabeth who are going to invest in their commercial and animal husbandry activities.

loans.use: to buy chicks, concentrate, feed, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo. 
Salha is a 24-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband in a very simple house. Salha's husband works at a carpentry workshop he has owned for four years. It is a good job but still needs a lot of improvements like more machines. 
Salha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy a special machine for his carpentry workshop. This will enable him to produce wood boards of a better quality. This will increase the demand for his products and also his income will increase.

loans.use: to buy a special machine for her husband's carpentry workshop

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 37-year-old married man from Gaza City. He is a father with two sons and one daughter. Iyad works as an employee in a local company and he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover the family expenses. For the past five years, Iyad has had a small store for electrical machine parts. He works there after his job. It is hard for him but this is the only way to provide his family with all they need. 

Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell and also expand his store. This will improve his business and also his income.
 
Iyad appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell and also expand his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for surgery for his eye

loans.name: Serine

texts.en:
Serine is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband. She has been selling cosmetics for two years. Twice a week, Serine purchases new stock of supplies from Yerevan and then sells them in the local market of Vanadzor. Due to her kind attitude toward people, Serine has gained many loyal customers. The income that she gathers helps her and her husband to cover her family's basic needs.
 
Now, for purchasing new stock of supplies, this hardworking woman has no financial means. So, she is asking for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of cosmetics to sell to her customers. 

Serine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Serine and will be a great support to her small business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics for selling to customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is an experienced farmer from Mrgavet village in the Ararat region of Armenia. She lives with her three sons. The youngest is a contract serviceman. 

To meet her family's daily needs, Mariam cultivates tomatoes, eggplant and peppers as well as peaches and apricots. Horticulture is an important source of income for the family. 

Mariam's sons assist her greatly in the everyday activities of horticulture. They help her bring her agricultural products to the local market. 

Mariam needs to make some investments in her agribusiness for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of $3,000 (US) will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family. It will enable her to renovate the greenhouse, replace the soil in the greenhouse, where the plants are cultivated, and purchase fertilizers. 

This family relies on the goodwill of lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount to sustain the family's agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse, replace the soil in the greenhouse and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance. He is married with six children. He works six days in a week and works six hours per day on average. He is into brick making which he has done since 2003. He started brick making so that he could earn income to sustain his family. He makes bricks in Ruyonza Local Cell 1 and he hopes to use the loan money of two million shillings to buy firewood, which he will use to bake the bricks he makes. His clients are mainly the builders and the general population who use bricks for construction purposes. His main challenge is rain which sometimes hits and damages his bricks before they dry hence causing him a shortage. Apart from brick making, David also sells timber which gives him additional income to support his family. He describes himself as a very hard-working man and he strongly believes that he will achieve his dream of expanding his business with the help of Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy firewood for baking bricks.

loans.name: Laiza Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo conformado por dos mujeres y un varón; se caracterizan por poseer un espíritu emprendedor y muestran entusiasmo en el trabajo que realizan. Este grupo es originario de Bilwi, y hace dos años y medio que se conformaron y trabajan solidariamente.

Fanny, es madre soltera de dos adolescentes y dos niños de 10 y 4 años. Es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora de 38 años de edad. Desde hace 6 años decidió establecer una tienda de abarrotería en su casa, con capital propio, en la cual vende: Pan, jugos, sopas instantáneas, meneítos, galletas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, crema, pollo. Con el propósito de tener una fuente de ingreso pero que a la vez le permitiera estar cerca cuidando a  sus hijos.

Con el objetivo de fortalecer su pequeño negocio solicita un crédito para comprar: 1 Quintal de arroz, 1 qq. de azúcar, 1 bidón de aceite, 50 libras de pollo, 20 libras de carne molida, 5 bolsas de mortadela, salchicha y bolsas de crema.

Sueña con llegar a tener su propia distribuidora cerca de su casa y tener una tienda de ropa y calzado, para incrementar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus hijos.

Nota: En la fotografia aparece Henry,debido a que el ha invertido el prestamo que ha solicitado su esposa Celka

Celka, solicito financiamiento para apoyar a su esposo Henry, quien tiene un taxi que es su herramienta de trabajo; solicita financiamiento para comprar repuestos para mantener en buenas condiciones mecánicas su taxi. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y comprar otro taxi.

Zulema, desde hace 10 años tiene un taller donde repara electrodomésticos; solicita financiamiento para comprar repuestos que le permitan tener un stock para no demorar mucho en el servicio que brinda a la población y asegurar sus ingresos.

Nota: En la fotografia aparece Henry,debido a que el ha invertido el prestamo que ha solicitado su esposa Celka
texts.en:
This group consists of two women and one man.  They are noted for their enterprising spirit and the enthusiasm they have for the work they do.  The group is from Bilwi and they joined together two and a half years ago and have been working well together.

Fanny is a single mother of two adolescents and two children who are 10 and 4 years old.  She’s a hardworking, striving, 38-year-old woman.  She decided to open a grocery store at home six years ago using capital of her own aiming at having a source of income while being able to be home watching after her children.  She sells bread, juice, instant soup, cheese puffs, cookies, rice, sugar, beans, cream, chicken, etc.  

Aiming at strengthening her small business, she’s asking for a loan to buy one quintal of rice, one quintal of sugar, a large jug of oil, 50 pounds of chicken, 20 pounds of ground meat, 5 bags of mortadella, sausage and bags of cream.

She dreams with having her own supply center near home and to have a clothing and shoe store to increase income and continue supporting her children’s education.

Note:  Henry appears in the photo because he’s invested the loan his wife, Celka, requested.  Celka requested the loan to help her husband, Henry, who has a taxi as a work tool.  She requests financing to buy spare parts to keep the taxi in good mechanical condition.  Her dream is to make home improvements and to buy another taxi.

Zulema has had an electronics repair shop for ten years.  She requests financing to buy spare parts to have stock on-hand so that customer service won’t be delayed much and she can insure her income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es separada tiene dos hijas pequeñas que no estan en etapa escolar; viven en casa de su hermano pero no cancela ningun tipo de alquiler pero paga parte de los servicios basicos del hogar, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario, tiene un pequeño taller donde realiza el armado de libros de quimica, fisca, matematica y diccionarios. Los mismos los comercializa al por mayor.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir material de contruccion(principalmente cemento y ladrillo) ya que realizara el amurallado de su terreno.
El sueño de Maria tener su casa propia-
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is separated. She has two small daughters who are not yet in school. They live in her brother’s house; she doesn’t pay any rent, but she does pay for some of the basic household expenses. The home is located in the center of the Mariscal Sucre neighborhood in the city of El Alto. 

Maria has completed elementary school. She has a small shop where she makes books about chemistry, physics, math, and dictionaries. She sells them in bulk. 

She needs the loan to buy construction materials (mainly cement and brick) since she’s constructing a  walled fence on her land. Maria’s dream is to have her own home. This is her fourth time lending through IMPRO and her first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to build a walled fence on her land.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 32-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife, two sons and one daughter. Alaa works in a small clothing store he has owned for the past year. It is a good business but with very limited capital. Alaa would like to develop his store by adding more products to resell
Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more kids clothes for his store to resell. By applying this loan, Alaa will be able to increase his productivity and also his income
Alaa would like to take a bigger loan in the future to plant olive trees on his land.
Alaa appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more clothing products for his store to resell

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Chernor. He is married, and has three children aged 14, 9, and 6. In 2007, Chernor established his provisions and confectioneries business. He began his business just to enable him to adequately take care of his family. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Chernor has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy: dozens of sardines-1,000,000, carton of batteries-1,000,000, carton of Peak milk-500,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his additional income, which he can use to solve his domestic problems. In the future, Chernor plans to build a house, to rent a shop in the city center and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for his shop.

loans.name: Kazozakeza Ii Group

texts.fr:
Astérie  fait partie du groupe Kazozakeza II  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a  38 ans et est mariée  à Venuste, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 12 ans, dont 1  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique(limonade, les habits, les sachet,...)   depuis  15ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique(les sachets, les habits, les limonades,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Astérie is part of the Kazozakeza II group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 38 years of age and is married to Venuste, a retailer. Together they have five children aged between 3 and 12, one of whom is at school.

Astérie works selling store items (lemonade, clothing, bags), and has done so for 15 years. This is her first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she receives, she plans to increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (bags, clothing, lemonade), which she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (bags, clothing, lemonade), which she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Usa Group

texts.es:
Yaoska, tiene 24 años de edad, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi es madre soltera de dos pequeños niños. Desde hace cinco años vende ropa usada, inició con 3 pacas vendiéndolas en las paradas de buses, actualmente cuenta con un tramo en el mercado, donde estableció su pequeña tienda de ropa usada y donde tiene bajo su cuidado a sus hijos. Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar más pacas de ropa que demanda la gente, incrementar su clientela vendiendo a precios accesible. 

Esta joven, también acopia mariscos que los distribuye  al comercio minorista en conjunto con su mamá. Su sueño es establecer su propio centro de acopio, tener una bonita tienda de ropa y asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Ana Jasmara, acopia mariscos y los distribuye a las empresas pesqueras de la ciudad, también vende queso en su casa. Solicita financiamiento para poder comprar y vender más mariscos y queso, que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos.

Ana Maria, también acopia mariscos y los distribuye a las empresas pesqueras de la ciudad. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más mariscos.
texts.en:
Yaoska, 24, is from the city of Bilwi and is a single mother of two children.  She’s sold used clothes for five years.  She started out with three bundles that she sold at bus stops.  She currently has a space in the market where she set up her small used clothing store and where she cares for her children.  She wants the loan to buy more bundles of clothes to meet demand and increase her clientele selling at affordable prices.  This young woman also sells seafood in the retail market with her mother.  Her dream is to set up her own gathering center and to have a pretty clothing store to guarantee her children’s education.

Ana Jasmara gathers seafood to sell to fishing firms in the city.  She also sells cheese at home.  She requests financing to be able to buy and sell more seafood and cheese to improve her income.

Ana María also gathers seafood to sell to city fish firms.  She requests financing to buy more seafood.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Universo Group

texts.es:
Elbira, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, tiene 26 años y dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años vende marisco, que maneja en termos con hielo y los vende de manera ambulante. Su jornada de trabajo es de las 6am-11: am, lo que le ha permitido contar con mayores ventajas para atender y cuidar a sus hijos.

Solicita financiamiento para comprar más mariscos: pescado, camarón, caracol, langosta. Su sueño es tener la capacidad económica para mejorar su vivienda, construirla de cemento.

Bayola, tiene una venta de comestibles y venta de fritanga en el mercado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más productos: arroz, filipitas, plátanos, frijoles, meneítos, jugos, carne.

Nidia. Tiene una tienda de comestible y venta de ropas y calzados en el mercado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más productos para su pulpería.
texts.en:
Elbira, 26, is from the city of Bilwi; she has two children.  She’s sold seafood for ten years.  She sells it from place to place from thermal containers packed with ice.  Her work day is from 6-11am which gives her the advantage of being able to tend to and care for her children.

She’s requesting financing to buy more seafood like fish, shrimp, conch and lobster.  Her dream is to have the economic capability to make home improvements, to build it out of cement.

Bayola sells fried fast-food in the market. She’s requesting the loan to buy more ingredients like rice, bananas, plantain, beans, corn puffs, juice, meat.

Nidia has a food store and sells clothes and shoes in the market.  She requests financing to buy more supplies for her pupusa [filled, grilled corn cakes] shop.

loans.use: to buy more seafood.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es casado y tiene un hijo pero aun no asiste al colegio, vive en casa de sus suegros, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario, el trabaja como ayudante de torneria la cual queda ubicada cerca a su domicilio. Su esposa se queda exclusivamente al cuidado de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar  material de construccion (cemento, arena) ya que realizara la refaccion de su cocina y el vaciado de cemento de su patio.
El sueño de Jhonny es tener un taller propio de torneria.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonny is married and has one son who doesn't go to school yet.  He lives in his in-laws' house, which is located in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto.  

He studied until high school.  He works as a turnery assistant, and his workplace is located near his home.  His wife focuses exclusively on taking care of their son.

He needs this loan to buy construction material (cement, sand), since he will repair his kitchen and the cement dug-out of his patio.

Jhonny's dream is to have his own turnery workshop.  This is the fourth time he applying for a loan with IMPRO, and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and other materials to repair his kitchen and to cement the patio of his house.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata est une femme très active et très brave, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle loge dans un petit village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville. Elle évolue dans la vente de crevettes et de poissons frais, activité qu’elle fait depuis plus de 10 ans déjà. Elle est obligée de travailler à des heures tardives pour pouvoir avoir de la marchandise fraiche, surtout en ce qui concerne les crevettes. Elle quitte chez elle à 17h de l’après midi pour en revenir à 3h du matin. Elle place sa marchandise dans des hôtels avec qui elle travaille et le reste, elle l’expose dans sa cantine qui se trouve dans le marché.
Salimata vient solliciter son 6ème prêt à l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir augmenter son stock car c’est la période des crevettes et que la demande a augmenté. Son objectif actuel est d’agrandir sa cantine pour hausser son activité à un degré plus élevé, mais aussi, d’aider ses enfants qui ont le permis, à avoir un départ.
texts.en:
Salimata is a very active and courageous woman, who is married and has five children. She lives in a little village located a few kilometers from the main city, and has worked selling fresh shrimp and fish for more than 10 years now. Salimata is forced to work late hours so that she can have fresh merchandise, something which is particularly important for the shrimp she sells. She leaves home at 5 in the evening and doesn’t get home until 3 in the morning. Most of her produce is sold to the hotels she works with, and she sells the rest in the little stall she has in the market.

Salimata has just requested her sixth loan from UIMCEC. This will allow her to increase her stock, as it is shrimp season and demand has risen. Her current goal is to expand her small stall to increase her business even more, as well as to enable her children to have a good start in life.

loans.use: To buy fresh shrimp and fish for resale.

loans.name: Tugwizibikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe  Tugwizibikorwa  et  habite à  Bubanza. Elle   a  40 ans et est mariée  à Bruno, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de  10 à 14 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, farine de manioc,…)   depuis 20 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle   obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de  sa boutique (riz, haricot, farine, de manioc…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  acheter un véhicule   et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanne is part of the Tugwizibikorwa group, and lives in Bubanza. She is 40 years of age and married to Bruno, a retailer. Together they have five children aged between 10 and 14. All of their children are at school.

Jeanne has worked selling store items (rice, beans, cassava flour) for 20 years, and this is her first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she receives, she plans to increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (rice, beans, cassava flour), which she will resell to earn more. Over the coming years, Jeanne would like to buy a vehicle and see her children continue studying.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (rice, beans, cassava flour), which she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Sol De Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
Carina, tiene 28 años de edad, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Es vendedora ambulante de yuca, malanga, plátanos, quequisque, frutas, carbón, entre otros. Está solicitando préstamo para poder aumentar los productos que oferta y generar más ingresos para poder construir su vivienda de concreto y establecer su negocio en un tramo en el mercado de Bilwi. 

Berta y Haidina, tienen un tramo en el mercado, donde venden granos básicos: frijoles, maíz y bastimentos. (yuca, malanga, quequisque, plátanos, bananos, filipitas). Solicitan financiamiento para comprar más productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Carina, 28, is from the city of Bilwi.  She’s married and has two children.  She’s a cassava, ‘malanga’ [a starchy tuber], banana, ‘quequisque’ [a starchy tuber], fruit and charcoal, among others street vendor.  She’s asking for a loan to increase the products she sells to earn higher income to be able to build her house out of concrete and to set up her business in space in the Bilwi market.

Berta and Haidina have market spaces where they sell basic grains like beans, corn and supplies (cassava, malanga, quequisque, bananas, plantain, etc.)  They are requesting financing to buy more products for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda es casada tiene seis hijos de los caules cuatro ya formaron su hogar y dos de sus hijos los ayudan con el trabajo de la familia , viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella no pudo ir al colegio por la falta de dinero ,actualmente se dedica a la elaboracion de salteñas y rollos de queso los cuales los vende en su pequela tienda de barrio y  distribuye a otras tiendas.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir un horno industrial, ya que el que posee esta un poco deteriorado por el tiempo de uso, asi podra ofrecer a sus cliente productos mas saludables.
El sueño de  Fernanda es convertirse es una distribuidora al por mayor de estos productos.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Fernanda is married and has six children of whom four live in her home and two help with the family business. They live in their own home located in the Satelite neighborhood in the city of El Alto. 

She was not able to go to college due to a lack of money. Right now she works making turnovers and cheese rolls that she sells in her little neighborhood store and distributes to other stores. 

She needs a loan to rent an industrial oven since her small one is deteriorating from use. That way she can offer her clients tastier products. 

Fernanda’s dream is to become a wholesale distributor of her goods. This is her third loan from IMPRO and her second from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to make turnovers and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Rebecah

texts.en: Rebecah is a 60-year-old married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. She also operates a food kiosk to earn extra income. Her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds to support her business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy animal feeds. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es separada; tiene tres hijos que  de los cuales solo dos estan en nivel escolar, vive en casa propia la se encuentra ubicada en la zona Lagunas de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica a la venta de condimentos en distintas ferias de la urbe alteña.Ella cubre todos los gastos de la familia.
El crédito lo requiere para completar cancelar los gastos que implica la instalacion del servicio de alcantarillado, y el nivelado de suelo en su casa.
El sueño de Francisca es tener su casa contruida y brindarles mayor comodidad de vida a sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Francisca is separated. She has three children of whom only two are in elementary school. She lives in her own home located in the Lagunas area in the city of El Alto. 

She’s studied through elementary school, and right now she sells spices in the different fairs around the city. She covers all of the family’s expenses. 

She needs a loan to pay off the debt incurred in the installation of a sewer system and a floor in her home. 

Francisca’s dream is to finish building her home and give her children a more comfortable life. This is her first time lending through IMPRO and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of a sewer system and a floor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for his shop.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has four children aged 20, 17, 11 and 7. In 2008, Memunatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to support her children's education as her husband is late. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are mostly women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Memunatu requires a loan in order to pieces of wax cotton for Le 2,000,000 and pieces of dry cotton for Le 1,000,000. She hopes that this loan increases her stock level. In the future, Memunatu plans to educate her children and to improve her business. She thanks Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 47 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city. Marine is married and has a school-aged son. 

Marine has graduated from Vnadzor State Pedagogical Institute Philological department. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. Marine’s husband works at the local orphanage as a security officer. Marine’s retired mother also lives with their family. 

Marine also gives paid courses of Armenian language and literature at her home, and she prepares pupils for entrance examinations. She is a very clever and wise pedagogue, and she provides both her school lessons and individual courses interactively and in a very interesting manner. 

As Marine says, no matter how hard she works, nevertheless she needs to have a computer for organizing lessons full of useful information. For this purchase, she asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: to buy a computer for organizing lessons full of useful information.

loans.name: Nafina

texts.en: This is 54-year-old Nafina. She is married, and has three children aged 39, 35 & 26. She has three additional dependents, who live with her for assistance. In 2007, Nafina established her drinks business. She began her business because she was retired from work. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Nafina requires a loan in order to buy more drinks for resale. In the future, Nafina plans to become an international business women and to build a house. She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Twunganire Iii Group

texts.fr:
Lydie fait partie du groupe  Twunganire III  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a  28 ans et est célibataire .

Elle fait le commerce du haricot, riz,...  depuis  6 mois. 

C’est son  premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle   obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité du riz et de  haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Lydie is a member of the Twunganire III group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and single. She has been selling beans, rice etc for six months. This is her first loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans  for resale so as to increase her earnings.

loans.use: she will bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans  for resale so as to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Allah Kademe Group

texts.fr:
Mme GOMPOKO MARIE CLAIRE représente le groupe ALLAH KADEME. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 42ans et le moins âgé de 19ans. 02 vont à l’école et  elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des bijoux et pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans un marché de la place . Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 20complets de bijoux.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut ouvrir un magasin de bijoux et pagnes. Mme ambitionne acheter des parcelles  pour ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Gompoko Marie Claire is the representative of the Allah Kademe group. She is married and mother to two children, the oldest of whom is 42 and the youngest 19. Both her children go to school, and she has three people under her care in total.

Gompoko Marie Claire has worked for 10 years selling jewelry and pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth]. She gets her supplies in a local market, and her customers are female. She would like to buy 20 sets of jewelry. With her profits, Gompoko Marie Claire would like to open a store selling jewelry and pagnes. In the future, she would like to buy plots of land for her children.

loans.use: To buy 20 sets of jewelry.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata est membre de Banc villageois depuis 5 ans, elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts à temps

Salimata est mariée. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mère d'une petite fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques, elle a une bonne expérience de 5 ans.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la capitale et revend dans sa ville.

Elle souhaite avec  son prêt acheter des tissus en grande quantité pour revendre et elle espère avec la fête de Tabaski qui approche faire beaucoup de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices obtenus elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille et compte développer son épargne.
texts.en:
Salimata has been a member of the banc villageois for five years, and has always repaid her loans on time. She is 32 years of age, married, and mother to a young daughter. She works selling fabrics and cosmetic products, and has five years of good experience. She gets her supplies in markets in the capital city, and resells them in her town.

With her loan, Salimata would like to buy a large quantity of fabrics for resale. With the upcoming Tabaski festival she hopes to make a lot of money. With the profit she obtains, Salimata provides for her family and hopes to be able to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 48 años de edad,  es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años de edad. Habita en casa humilde pero propia desde hace  ocho años. Ella se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos, tiene muchos años de laborar para una familia quien le remunera cada mes por su trabajo.  Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y con mucho esfuerzo le va haciendo mejoras para que en un futuro poder heredar a su pequeño hijo y en el presente poder  darle mejores condiciones. Desea mejorar el piso y reforzar las paredes de su humilde casa para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, lámina y madera ya que son necesarios para darle el mantenimiento necesario y urgente a su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is 48 years old and a single mother with a 12-year-old son. She lives in a house that is humble but of her own, and has done so for the last 8 years. She makes a living from the provision of domestic help. She has been doing this for many years for a family that pays her monthly for her work.

Margarita's main possession is her home, to which she makes improvements with great effort, so as to be able to inherit it to her young son to give him a better quality of life. She wants to improve its floor and reinforce its walls, which is why she is requesting this loan to FUSAI. She will use it to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting and wood since these are needed to give necessary and urgent maintenance to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting and wood to improve the floor and reinforce the walls of her home

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 66 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad  e independientes con familia aparte. Solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, es viudo, su esposa murio ya hace varios años.

Jesús desde pequeño, su padre le enseño las labores agricolas, para que ayudara a aportar ingresos a la familia, hoy en día se lavanta a las 5 de la mañana, para alistarce e ir a trabajar a sus parcelas, después de 4 horas regresa a su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar 2 vacas lecheras, aprovechara los residuos de su cosecha para alimentarlas y obtener leche que le servira para consumo y para la venta. Si todo sale bien espara muy pronto comprar otras dos vacas y aumentar la produccion.
texts.en:
Jesus is 66 years old and has three adult children with families of their own.  [Jesus] was only able to study to sixth grade.  He is a widower and his wife died several years ago.

Jesus taught him to be a farmer when he was very young, so that he could help generate income for the family.  Now he gets up every morning at 5:00 am to get ready to go work his land and returns home after four hours.

He will use the money from this loan to buy two dairy cows and take advantage of his residual harvest to feed them and obtain milk to drink and sell.  If all goes well, he hopes to be able to  buy two more cows and increase production soon.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Sia. She is married, and has three children aged 23,17 & 8. She has two additional dependents, who live with her for assistance. In 2003, Sia established her palm oil and charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband with some family responsibilities. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sia requires a loan in order to buy more containers of palm oil, and bags of charcoal for resale. In the future, Sia plans to build a house and to educate her children. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more containers of palm oil, and bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase engines for his vehicles, for commercial use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pineapples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of pineapple.

loans.name: Seibatu

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Seibatu. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 5. In 2008, Seibatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to support her children's education as a single parent. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are mostly women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Seibatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of brazian [hair extensions] for Le 700,000, pieces of wax cotton for Le 2,000,000 and dozens of baby clothes for Le 1,000,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit. In the future, Seibatu plans to build a house, to get married and to educate her children. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wax cotton and dry cotton, to resell at her business.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi est un homme âgé de 44ans marié à une revendeuse et sans enfants. Il est soudeur et gérant d´une cafétéria en servant toutes personnes. Par manque de congélateur, il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES  pour l’achat d’un congélateur pour la cafétéria et de l’achat de boissons pour la revente. Il envisage d’ouvrir une autre cafétéria. Il exerce depuis 2011 l'activité.
texts.en:
Komi is a 44-year-old man, has no children, and is married to a retailer. He works as a welder and also manages a café, where he serves all kinds of people. As he doesn’t have a freezer, he has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy one for his café, as well as to purchase drinks for resale. 

Komi has been working in this business since 2011, and would like to open another café in the future.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for his café.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé, jeune femme âgée de 33ans mariée à un pasteur avec  deux enfants dont l’ainé a 9ans et le dernier 7ans. Elle exerce depuis 2010 dans la vente de bonbons, des biscuits, jus, pure water, des cartes de recharges et de transfert de crédit. Sa difficulté est due à une mévente dans certaines saisons. Elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour l’achat de sachets de pure water, des crédits pour transfert, des biscuits, bonbons et autres en vue d’économiser pour acheter en gros. Elle espère devenir grossiste et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
Amélé is a young, 33-year-old woman who is married to a shepherd. They have two children, the oldest of whom is 9 and the youngest 7. Since 2012 Amélé has worked selling candies, cookies, juice, pure water and money transfer cards, and the difficulty she faces is a lack of sales during certain seasons. 

Amélé has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy sachets of pure water, money transfer cards, cookies, candies and other items, so that she can save by buying in bulk. She would like to become a wholesaler, as well as to have a family that does well for itself.

loans.use: To buy sachets of pure water, money transfer cards, and cookies.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in the village of Ddmashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has a daughter and a son. Her husband has no constant work as he is hired to do some reconstruction work from time to time. They have no other source of income other than farming and agriculture. Gayane has a large plot of land on which she cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, greens and cabbage. Her farm is also not poor. She is raising three cows, a calve, nine sheep and forty chickens. The milk, meat and eggs Gayane manages to sell through resellers.

She is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle in order for them to pass a warm and well fed winter.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 28 years old and married. In 2009, Mohamed established his soft drinks, pure water, and electronics business. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 350,000 SLL every month. 

Mohamed is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy soft drinks and pure water.  In the future, he plans to further his education, own a bigger shop, and raise children.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and pure water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapple, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapple to sell, thus improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of pineapple.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area that is conducive of farming, and his primary customers are retailers.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be problematic rain seasons. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. 

His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet his family's needs. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pineapple, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of pineapple.

loans.name: Susan Voronika

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Susan Voronika. She is single and has no children. 

In 2011, Susan Voronika established her business selling drinks, mayonnaise, etc. She began her business because she wanted to help herself. Working six days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

Susan Voronika would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more business stock for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow her business. 

In the future, Susan Voronika plans to further her education to a higher level and also to build a house. She is very hard-working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more business stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapple, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add stocks of tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon , es soltero tiene dos hijos , vive en casa en alquiler la cual cancela mensualmente , la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel primaria. Simon es musico de una banda donde  presta sus servicios para diferentes acontecimientos en general. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra  un instrumento (Bajo) asi poder cumplir con sus presentaciones y poder tener mejores ingresos, pues su instrumento actual no responde perfectamente. 
El sueño de Simon  es que su banda tenga muchos integrantes ,poder dar trabajo .  
Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Simon is single, has 2 children and lives in a house for which he pays a monthly rent.  The house is located in the Rio Seco zone of El Alto.  He has a primary school education.  Simon is a musician in a band that performs at various events.  

The loan he is seeking will be used to purchase an instrument (a bass), that will allow him to perform and increase his earnings, since his current instrument does not respond well.  Simon's dream is for his band to have many members so he can give people jobs.  This is the second time he has sought a loan with  IMPRO and his first with KIVA.

loans.use: purchase a bass for the band he plays in.

loans.name: Yamilka

texts.es:
Yamilka , es soltera tiene una hija de 10 meses de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la confeccion de vestidos de niña para acontecimientos (Bautizo) y otros trabajos de confeccion en general. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de tela y otros accesorios  asi poder tener a disposiscion material para asi poder cumplir con sus requerimientos 
El sueño de Yamilka  es tener su tienda en la zona central en la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yamilka is single and has a 10 month old daughter.  She lives in her parents home which is in the Rio Seco zone of El Alto.  She has a secondary school school education.  She works as seamstress, making girls' dresses for events (Baptisms) and other clothing in general.  

The loan she is seeking will be used to purchase fabrics and other accessories in order to have material at her disposal to be able to fulfill her requirements.  Yamilka's dream is to have her own store in the central zone of the city of La Paz.  This is the first time she has sought a loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: purchase fabrics and accessories to make dresses for girls and other clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She wants to start another business of grinding maize to produce maize flour to sell. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to purchase a maize grinding mill. Her business goal is to be independent within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a maize grinding mill to produce maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapples, thus aiding him in improving his overall sales.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a general store where she sells water containers. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a high-potential place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water containers to sell. Her business goal is to be an importer of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

loans.use: buy water containers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pineapple, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapples, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Artsvik

texts.en:
Artsvik is from Kapan town where she lives with her husband and daughter. She is a teacher with many years of teaching experience. Together with her work at a local school, Artsvik also provides individual lessons for pupils.
Due to her hard work, Artsvik already has 15 pupils and provides Russian language classes for them. 
Because of the family's living conditions, Artsvik isn't able to purchase chairs and other products that she needs for her work. So, with this loan Artsvik wants to purchase a computer, printer and chairs for providing individual lessons, which will greatly assist her classes and will make them more effective.
Artsvik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
The loan is very important for Artsvik and she hopes for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for a computer, printer and chairs for providing individual lessons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of pineapples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Enjoying the respect of her family and community, Ibtisam worked and works hard to earn this respect. While the start was not easy, 3 years into her business endeavors she is confident and has the potential for success with her growing business.

Ibtisam is a 48 years old Iraqi woman, living in the South part of the country. As a divorced woman she is raising her 4 children alone supporting the family through her business' income.

She is the owner of an important little shop, a unique project by woman for women. Specializing in selling clothing and accessories for women and children, Ibtisam attracts many women customers who enjoy shopping in a safe and comfortable environment with assistance of a female sales person.

Ibtisam's customers greatly enjoy the benefits of shopping for their personal items at a store run by a woman who is also a mother and can provide advice on sizing, quality, and availability of items.

Ibtisam's growing business and willingness to learn and develop her business skills qualifies her to participate in the WLIFT program and take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 14,000 USD. With the loan she plans to purchase more and better quality merchandise as well as improve the store to offer an even better shopping experience for women in her area.

Ibtisam enjoys working in her project and with hard work and ambition dreams to have a large, unique shopping center for women.

loans.use: to purchase more and better quality merchandise as well as improve the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel es una Sra. joven Soltera, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas en su casa, además a la mañana trabaja con una amiga en su casa. Compra las prendas de Argentina y del Brasil viajando semanalmente.
Comenta que se inició con  un dinero que junto con otros trabajos anteriores, mes a mes va aumentando su negocio con el dinero que con arduo esfuerzo recibe. Es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación.
Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Mabel is a single young woman. She has a small business selling clothing out of her home, and in the mornings she also works with a friend at her house. She buys clothing from Argentina and Brazil during on weekly trips. She said that she started this business with money that she had earned from previous jobs. Month by month she is growing her business with this hard-earned money. She is a responsible person who yearns to get ahead. The credit she is asking for today will be invested in the purchase of various types of clothing. This will let her continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad,  es casada, estudio hasta noveno grado. Procreo 4 hijos, pero ya no viven con ella.
Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo  que se dedica a realizar actividades de jornal.

María  se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que su madre le enseño desde pequeña, junto a su esposo camina un 1 K.m. Para llegar a la parcela que siembran juntos durante la mañana y en la tarde, ella se dedica a elaborar comida típica (tamales, atol, yuca, etc.) y su esposo trabaja en un beneficio como vigilante

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente esta dañado y cuando entra el invierno se filtra el agua y le daña las cosas que posee.

planea en un futuro, construir un cafetin, donde ofrecerá los productos típicos que elabora y así poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old. She is married, and studied through the ninth grade. She has four children, but they don't live with her now. She wakes up at 5:00am, and alongside her husband, they start their daily work.

Maria is a farmer, an occupation that she learned from her mother as a small child. She and her husband walk the 1 kilometer to their parcel of land where they plant together in the morning. In the afternoon, she makes typical food, such as tamales, atol, and yuca, and her husband works as guard in a plant.

The loan that she is seeking is to repair the roof of their home. It is damaged currently, and when winter comes, the water will come in and damage their things. In the future, she plans to build a snack stand where she will sell the food she prepares and thus earn greater income.

loans.use: repair her roof before winter rains come

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 27-year-old, married man. He has two children, one and two years old. He describes himself to be honest. 

Edwin operates a carpentry store where he makes beds, tables, stools, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be security. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy timber to make furniture. His business goal is to open other carpentry outlets within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be happy and successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
El Sr. Quintin  es  casado, tiene 2 hijos mayores casados e independiente de él y su esposa. Ambos tienen un negocio de compostura de calzado y venta de zapatos usados. Se iniciaron en la actividad con un dinero que recibió Quintin como parte de una indemnización que había recibido en un trabajo que realizo anteriormente. 
El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposa sus hijos hoy son personas de bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados usados para poder seguir con sus ventas y generando el ingreso para la casa.
texts.en:
Quintin is married and has two adult children that live independently. He and his wife have a shoe repair shop where they also sell used shoes. They started their business with some money that Quintin received as part of a compensation package from a job he previously had. 

He is a very responsible person who is eager to improve himself. He has a jovial and enterprising spirit and has no doubt that he will achieve all the goals he has set himself. He says that his children are upstanding people today thanks to his and his wife's effort.

He is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing used shoes, so they can keep up their sales and continue generating income for their household.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma tiene actualmente 55 años, tiene varios hijos pero ya todos mayores. Junto con su marido se dedican a atender una despensa hace ya varios años, además tiene una propiedad con varias piezas que alquila. Ambos son mayores y no tienen personas a su cargo. Empezaron con un pequeño capital hace aproximadamente 20 años. 
Vendiendo yerba, azúcar, harina, y demás alimentos básicos no perecederos en el barrio. Como les fue bien se animaron a invertir más en el negocio, fue así que compraron más productos y creció bastante su negocio.
Por ese motivo y gracias a sus ahorros lograron comprar una propiedad y fueron levantando pieza por pieza hasta completar 5 que tienen actualmente. 
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder reparar la fachada de las piezas que ella alquila, para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus inquilinos.
texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old and has a few children who are now all grown. Together with her husband she has managed a grocery store for many years. She also owns a property with various storefronts with she rents. They are both older and do not have any children to look after. They started 20 years ago with a small investment, selling herbs, surgar, flour, and other staple and non-perishable goods in the neighborhood. Things went well for them so they decided to invest more in their business, buying more products and growing their business substantially. 

With that motive and with their savings, they were able to buy a property and have constructed unit by unit until completing the fifth of five units they presently own. Norma is requesting this loan in order to repair the facades of the units which she rents so that she can continue to provide excellent service to her tenants.

loans.use: to repair facades in the units she rents out.

loans.name: Norma De La Cruz

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó con su negocio de tienda tiempo atrás y pudo montarlo gracias al dinero que recibió su esposo por motivo de su jubilación.  Trabaja sola durante el día, desde temprano.  Es viuda y sus hijos son todos mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias.  Sueña con tener su propio local y que esté muy bien adecuado.  Al momento necesita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Durán.  She started her store some time ago and was able to do so thanks to the money her husband got from his retirement.  She works alone during the day starting very early.  She’s a widow and all her children are adults with families of their own.  She dreams with having a locale of her own that’s very well equipped.  At the moment, she needs the loan to buy notebooks.

loans.use: to buy notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of pineapple

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pineapple

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Silvino tiene 22 años, está viviendo con su pareja, el es mecánico desde los 14 años, empezó primeramente como secretario de un vecino, luego monto un taller conjuntamente con su hermano, que prácticamente fue donde se hizo de un poco de capital y por pedido de varios clientes se decidió alquilar un local en donde montó un pequeño taller que fue fortaleciéndose a través de la fidelidad y preferencia de sus clientes, en la fecha ya tiene un taller bien formado y hasta repuestos para su venta que le genera aún más ingreso para con ello poder mejorar su calidad de vida y ayudarle a sus padres.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de herramientas y repuestos para que pueda usarlos en su taller, y así seguir dando a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Silvino is 22 years old. He is living with his partner. He has been a mechanic since he was 14 years old. He began first as a secretary to a neighbor, and later opened a workshop with his brother, and laboring there he made a bit of income and at the request of many customers he decided to rent a facility where he opened a small workshop that has gotten stronger through the loyalty and preference of his clients. Now he has a well established workshop and even spare parts for sale that generates even more income so that he can improve his quality of life and help his parents.

The loan that he is seeking will be used to invest in the purchase of tools and spare parts so that he can use them in his workshop, and thus continuing giving his customers good service.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay law school tuition.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino  es  productor de leche la cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio, la cual procesa y posteriormente vende al público. 
Vive junto a su esposa y  sus tres hijos dos de los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, su comunidad  se llama Liquiñoso se encuentra en el municipio de Pucarani a tres   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, la que diariamente entrega al recolector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaquilla de raza mejorada la cual a lo futuro se convertirá en una vaca en producción; el costa de la vaquilla es menor que el de una vaca lechera, por lo que le conviene ahora comprarla.

El sueño de Marcelino es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado. y así su producción, esto repercutirá en la mejora de la calidad de vida para su familia

Es la tercera vez vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a dairy farmer. He delivers his milk to a collection company that processes it and later sells it to the public.

He lives with his wife and their three school-age children. The name of their community is Liquiñoso, which is located in the town of Pucarani, three hours from the city of La Paz. He has several heads of cattle and he supplies their milk to the collector daily.

He is requesting this loan to buy an improved-breed calf, which will eventually grow into a milk-producing dairy cow. The cost of a calf is lower than the cost of a dairy cow, which is why it is better for him to buy it now. 

Marcelino's dream is to increase his cattle herd as well as his milk production. This will result in an improved quality of life for his family.

This is the third loan he is requesting through IMPRO and his second with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an improved-breed calf.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and the father of three young children. He describes himself as an aggressive businessman who works as a mason and builds houses. He has been involved in this job for three years, and largely works for contractors. He describes his biggest business challenge as meeting customer demand. He is requesting a loan for KES 20,000 to buy building equipment, including a mason's line and a trowel. He hopes that in the future, he will be running a stable and successful business.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Marina Esperanza

texts.es:
Marina de 65 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio , es madre de 3 hijos su esposo se dedica a la agricultura; sus hijos no viven con ellos; pero esta viviendo con ella una hermana, una sobrina y un nieto, los cuales le ayudan con las actividades agrícolas dependen de los ingresos de ella y su esposo. 

 Marina, se dedica a la agricultura (cultivo de maíz y frijol) ademas tienen una plantación de café, la cual ya esta produciendo, por lo que ellos tienen muchos años de experiencia sobre las actividades productivas que realizan. Los cuales lo han aprendió  de sus padres. para llegar a su cultivo, viaja quince  minutos a pie donde  labora de 6:00 .a m  a 11 de la mañana y luego se regresa para su casa y lo hace periódica mente con la ayuda de su familia .

 Con el crédito comprara fertilizantes y pesticidas para el cultivo 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz  y 7,000 de frijol que ya tiene sembrada, de los cuales espera tener mas ingresos para su familia y poder cancelar su crédito y con las ganancias seguir mejorando su vivienda.

El sueño que tiene Marina, es cuidar su pequeña finca y mejorar su vivienda   Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Marina, 65, did not attend school.  She’s mother of three children and her husband works in agriculture.  Her children do not live with them but a sister, niece and grandson do and they help with the agricultural chores her and her husband’s income depends on.

Marina works in agriculture growing corn and beans and they also have a coffee plantation that’s currently producing.  They have many years’ experience in the productive activities they carry out which they learned from their parents.  It takes her a 15-minute walk to reach her fields.  She works from 6am until 11 in the morning and then returns home.  She does this periodically with her family’s help.

The loan will be to buy fertilizer and pesticide for a 14,000 square meter corn crop and a 7,000 square meter bean crop that are already planted and from which she expects to earn more family income sufficient to repay her loan and to use profits to continue making home improvements.

Marina’s dream is to care for her small farm and to improve her home.  She’s sure that she will be able to reach all this as long as she continues to work hard like she’s done to date.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  es  productora de leche la cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio, la cual procesa y posteriormente vende al público. 
Vive sola, puesto que su madre con la que vivía por razones de salud se fue a vivir con una de sus hermanas a la ciudad de La Paz, su comunidad  se llama Liquiñoso se encuentra en el municipio de Pucarani a tres   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, la que diariamente entrega al recolector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaquilla la cual a lo futuro se convertirá en una vaca en producción.

El sueño de Martha es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado. y así su producción, esto repercutirá en la mejora de su calidad de vida .
Es la segunda vez vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Martha is a dairy farmer; she delivers her milk to a gathering firm that processes it for subsequent sale to the public.  She lives alone because her mother with whom she used to live went to live with one of her sisters in the city of La Paz due to health reasons.  

Her community is called Liquiñoso and is located in the municipality of Pucarani three hours from the city of La Paz.  She owns a few head of cattle that produce milk that she delivers daily to the collector.

She needs the loan to buy a heifer that will grow into a dairy cow.  Martha’s dream is to increase her herd size and as a result her production which will mean improved quality of life.  This is her second IMPRO and first KIVA loan request.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Juventud Alegre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jóvenes Alegres está en su 13º ciclo  del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde todos se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todos para salir adelante. Quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo pese a la corta edad que tienen.
Un joven integrante es Noelia, quien vende cosméticos y también hace zapatillas bordadas.  Es una joven con mucho ideal y quiere poder ayudar un poco en la casa y sentirse útil. Hoy pide de este préstamo para poder usarlo en la compra de cosméticos y también para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus zapatillas bordadas.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que a pesar de ser joven, se le da esta oportunidad. en la foto hay mas jóvenes, ya que algunos de ellos en este ciclo no han retirado crédito pero integran el grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Jóvenes Alegres” (Cheerful Youngsters) and is in its 13th cycle in the young people’s program.  All of them are committed to working hard and to help each other get ahead.  They want to be able to help their families by means of their work despite their young ages.

One of the young members is Noelia who sells cosmetics and also makes embroidered slippers.  She’s a young woman with high ideals who wants to be able to help a bit at home and to feel useful.  Today, she’s asking for this loan to be able to buy cosmetics and also to buy supplies to make her embroidered slippers.

She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting even though she’s young.  There are more young people in the photo even though some of them haven’t taken out funds in this loan cycle but they are members of the group anyway.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a Kiva borrower who operates a tailor shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years, and works in a good area where most of his customers live nearby. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of sufficient funds. He is requesting a loan for KES 50,000 to buy cloth and threads for making new clothes. His business goal is to own a big clothing shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy cloth and threads for making new clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a refrigerator and assorted wholesale items (pastries, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, canned goods, and coffee).

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está en su 4º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas están mejorando bastante su económica. El comité es muy unido y responsable salen adelante gracias al trabajo conjunto y perseverante que realizan. La idea es  que cada una de las integrantes desarrolle alguna actividad a fin de conseguir su independencia financiera.
Selva es una de las integrantes, quien tiene una despensa en su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y demuestra siempre mucho interés, ya que siempre esta positiva y trabajando. Pide de este crédito para poder comprar carnes panificados y productos en cantidad para abaratar los costos y ofrecer a sus clientes.
Todas ellas agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Kyrey is in its 4th cycle in the women’s committee program.  All are committed to working hard to help each other out in order to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and thanks to the work of all of them they are improving their economies quite a bit.  The committee is very unified and responsible and they get ahead thanks to their teamwork and perseverance.  The idea is that each one of them develops an activity to attain financial independence.

Selva is one of the members.  She has a home-based grocery store.  She’s a very hardworking woman who always shows much interest for she’s always positive and working.  She’s asking for this loan to buy meat, baked goods and products in quantity to lessen costs and sell to her customers.  

All of them are grateful for this opportunity they are getting what will be of much help to them.

loans.use: to stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Victoria está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo con grandes expectativas del programa de comité de mujeres, todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de todas.
La Sra. Ana solicita su préstamo para la compra de ropas  de variadas clases ya que se dedica en la venta ambulante de dichos productos. Comenta que esta esperanzada de que, a través de este grupo pueda ir mejorando su vida, su economía y también la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Victoria is in cycle #1; it’s a new group in the women’s committee program with high expectations.  All of them work and help each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey as a way to know each of their situations.

Ana is asking for her loan to buy assorted clothes for she works as a street vendor selling clothes.  She comments that she’s hopeful that by means of this group she will be able to improve her life and her economy as well as her family’s.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 personas  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS” una de ellas es la Sra. Marlene de 38 años conviviente  y con 2  hijos, la Sra. Marlene  se dedica ya hace 1 año a la venta de calzado de  zapatos tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Marlene   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Marlene  trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más zapatos para su posterior venta y  tener mas ingresos económicos. La Sra. Marlene está sentada en el sofá es la primera de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su chompa negra , la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank Señor de los Milagros is made up of 7 people working in various business activities. One of them is Marlene, 38 years old, who has a life-partner and 2 children.

Marlene has been working daily for 1 year in the sale of shoes, for women and men, in a small facility, with the goal of getting ahead and being able to pay school fees for her children. Through the strength of her efforts, Marlene is continuing improving her business, and has successfully improved housing and support for the education of her children. Her greatest desire is that her children become professionals which is why Marlene works hard.

She will use the loan to buy more shoes to later sell and have more financial income.

Marlene is sitting on the sofa, in the first place on the left hand side, wearing a black sweater, and sends forth a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo as she is grateful for the loan that makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy shoes for later resale

loans.name: Esmeralda De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Esmeralda de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros desde 15 años, es una persona amable, responsable, luchadora y con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, su tienda es muy demandada en la zona, gracias a la calidad de sus productos, y los excelentes precios que ofrece, además la zona donde está ubicada es muy buena para el comercio, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Esmeralda solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda como:  granos básicos, golosinas, dulces, azúcar, sopas, etc. Para poder abastecer la gran demanda que posee y así incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 37 years old and lives with her husband in her own house. She owns a store where for 15 years now, she has sold articles of primary necessity, including beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other items. Esmeralda is an agreeable, responsible and hard-working person who wishes to get ahead and advance her family. Her store is much in demand in the zone, thanks to the quality of its products and the excellent prices she offers. In addition, the zone where it's located is very good for commerce. In this manner, she has managed to cover many of her family's expenses.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store, including basic grains, sweets, sugar, soups, etc. Esmeralda wants to satisfy her current sizable customer demand and, thus, increase her income, offering her family a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, sugar, soups, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Valerosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Valerosas, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres valientes que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Ellas han hecho la encuesta de eliminación para conocer en que situación se encuentra cada una de ellas.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Dolmi quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 2, es decir un nivel medio de ingresos, pero debe seguir trabajando para mejorarlo. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las ventas que hace en su pequeña despensa está superándolo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leche, fideos, harina, aceite entre otros; lo que le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Valerosas” (Valiant Women) because that’s what they are: valiant women who joined together to be able to help their families by means of their work.  They’ve taken the poverty elimination survey to find out what each of their situations is.

One of them is Delmi who in the last survey was at poverty level 2, that is, medium income level but she must continue working to improve it.  By means of her effort and non-stop work and the sales in her small grocery store she’s overcoming.  She requested this loan to buy milk, noodles, flour and oil, among others which will improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy milk, noodles, flour and oil, among others.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Doña Ana es una clienta con 27 años de edad, madre de tres niños. Soltera y vive en unión libre con su compañero. Es trabajadora y esforzada para poder lograr sus objetivos. Se dedica al comercio. Tuvo la necesidad de comenzar a generar ingresos adicionales al hogar sin descuidar a su familia, debido a ésto se puso una pañalera en su misma casa. Ella tiene acondicionado un cuarto en el frente de su casa para la venta de sus productos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero en las decisiones a tomar. Solicita financiamiento para invertir mas variedad de mercadería, aumentar su inventario, asi mismo sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos, asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la desu familia.
texts.en: Doña Ana is 27 years old and mother to three children. She is not married and lives with her partner. She is hard-working and determined to be able to achieve her objectives. She is a businesswoman. She had to begin to generate additional income for her home without neglecting her children, so she opened a nursery supply store in her home. She remodeled a room in the front of her house to see her products. She depends on the support of her partner in making decisions. She seeks financing to invest in a greater variety of merchandise, increase her inventory and consequently her sales and have greater profits, thus improving the living condition of she and her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her nursery products business.
